Reviews.Title: “We found a bed bug.”
Reviews.Author: Lilshell812
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at Princess Bayside for a wedding (we got a group rate, which was pretty reasonable). Our first impressions were that the hotel was mediocre: stayable, mostly clean, not bad for the price. The shower pressure was pretty bad and the water temperature fluxuated a lot. After staying one night, my fiancee woke up with 3 bug bites on his behind. We did a check of the mattresses & didn't find any evidence of bed bugs anywhere. We weren't 100% sure that it came from the hotel so we didn't worry about it too much. The next morning I found one bug on his pillow. We immediately put it in a cup to bring with us when we checked out. We also checked online and made sure it was, in fact, a bed bug.The manager was very accommodating when we checked out and comped us for one night. She thanked us for bringing it to their attention and said they would seal off the room. The pros: - Location was very good. On the bay, close to the beach, and close to every place we needed to go for the wedding. - Walking distance to a lot of places (Seacrets, Macky's, liquor stores, the beach) - 2 pools, indoor and on the roof. The pools were nice but very crowded. - private access to the bay, very safe Cons: The bed bug (I'm don't think it's infested...I just think maybe the person who stayed in that room before us brought some with them.)

Reviews.Title: “A Fun, Relaxing Stay at the Princess Bayside!”
Reviews.Author: pjhershey
Reviews.Content: My son and I had a wonderful 4 days in August, when we stayed at the Princess Bayside! The front desk was able to get us in our room early on our first day. We enjoyed the property, the breakfast at Finnigan's, that was included with our package, was great! The rooftop pool was very refreshing! Thank you to the pleasant, accomodating staff that took care of us while were in Ocean City, MD.

Reviews.Title: “Standard room stay”
Reviews.Author: Courtney Z
Reviews.Content: It is in a great location! Right next to Seacrets, down the road from Mackys, easy bay and ocean/beach access. The standard rooms are standard and at a decent price. Only complaint for this room is the shower head. No water pressure and horrible. The hot and cold water would also change mid-shower, which was uncomfortable and annoyings. Besides this it is a nice hotel in a great location with a nice indoor and outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect amenities!”
Reviews.Author: ChaChi_301
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in the Deluxe and Bayfront efficiency rooms. Both have been clean and comfortable. Rooftop pool is nice, views of the sunset are beautiful and Seacrets is right next door :) Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay There This Season!”
Reviews.Author: Glenn D
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel! /// Cleanliness: Scrupulously clean! Really! No debris anywhere. Nothing "stored" in the corners of the lot, or in the garage spaces. No trash in the garage spaces or on the grounds anywhere. No odors. They polish the inside of the elevators! I saw them doing this! They clean the glass doors and walls daily. I saw them doing this. They really make an effort to keep this place looking like the multi-star resort it is. /// Parking: Plentiful parking, even when returning late at night from being out on the town. Covered parking is available, and I recommend you get one before they get full. Keeps your car cooler. The upper deck parking is usually open, but you'd better check the angle of that ramp. It's steep! /// Decor: Nice lobbies in each building. Lovely rooms and hallways. Very nicely appointed/decorated. New looking rooms and decor. Clean new linens. Memory Foam beds that are REALLY comfortable! Our room had a "kitchen" in it, and it was fully stocked with cooking tools. We could have used it, but didn't. Full sized refrigerator, which we did use. Microwave, which we reheated our coffee in. Coffee maker there, with coffee. /// Service: Call the desk for anything you need, and they are very responsive. We got an extra chair for the balcony immediately. We got some extra towels immediately (accidentally got wet). They helped us figure out the TV and Air Conditioning immediately. Very helpful desk. /// Rooftop Pool: Beautiful pool on the roof of the building! You must go to the pool at least once! I know, this is the beach! But, where else can you get a spectacular view of most of Ocean City, hear great music (not too loud), a full-service bar (great drinks, they make them strong here), shower, and bathrooms, all right at poolside?! We had a very enjoyable couple of hours up there on the rooftop pool. /// Checkout: Checkout time means checkout time... At 1100 AM. The locks are all electronic with card access. No, the lock will NOT work past checkout time. Do be out on time, or you'll have to go to the desk and have your card re-coded to retrieve your bags. /// Breakfast: If you want breakfast, do NOT go to Finnegan's as recommended by the staff. I think that they're required to do that since it's attached to their hotel. Instead, go to the Satellite Cafe right next door to them. Excellent breakfast! See my other review on them. Busy past 1000 AM, but well worth the wait. Go early if you can, then get to the beach afterwards. /// Smoking: NO smoking! They run a smoke-free facility here. It's posted too. /// Great stay here, and we WILL be coming back to this place! Lovely hotel, with great views of the bay. Short walk to the beach. And clean, clean, clean!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!!”
Reviews.Author: MB98
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2012. Convenient location to the beach. Free breakfast was included with our stay. Enjoyed the buffet breakfast everyday. Clean rooms, friendly staff. Only downside was the low flow shower. We stayed here last year also. Will return to this hotel next time. Good value for the price/3 nights for $399.00 breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location-needs some updating-priced well”
Reviews.Author: irish566
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was a standard room as there were no deluxe available and needed some updating for sure. Television was very small, wallpaper was peeling at one spot and black mold was showing behind the loose wallpaper. The rooftop pool is in a separate building and not the easiest to access. The lobby area and staff seemed polite and friendly. Nice location for bus stops and shops. One block to beach. If you are going for the beach and other attractions and don't plan on being in the room much it is a good location. I would go back but just make sure I had a remodeled room. I wasn't told that there was two completely separate buildings not connected in any way, only way to get to the main building to where the pool is, go outside, across a wide parking area not well lite and find elevator inside the other building to go to the roof. Parking is hit or miss and a little hard to come by. There was one ice machine in our building on another floor. Had no problem with wild parties going on as some guests reviewed. I have surely stayed at worse, clean compared to most.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE LOVE LOVE”
Reviews.Author: PrincesssS143
Reviews.Content: I stay here EVERY time I go to Ocean City and have been for the last 6 years!! BEST LOCATION!! Walking distance to Seacrets and Fagers! We always get the 2 queen beds with the pull out and all of our friends fit in! It's clean and always a good time. Also has a nice roof top pool!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: GCMNJ
Reviews.Content: While in OC I always stay at the Princess Bayside. The main is reason is because it is always very clean! The view of the sunset is awesome! Location is very convenient. It is a short walk to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: josh35b
Reviews.Content: I went in with somewhat low expectations after reading many reviews. I have stayed at this hotel 5 or so times in the past, but never for more than one night and only with other couples with the sole purpose of staying close to Seacrets. The trip last week was with my wife and twin four year olds. We got the $599 special which included a 5 night stay in a standard room with 2 queen beds and a breakfast buffet each morning. If you read the other reviews I will agree, yes the shower is extremely annoying, mainly with the low pressure, but also with the quick temp changes. Yes the elevator doors close very quickly and started to shut on my daughter while everyone in the elevator just stood and watched while I had to drop everything and push hard to keep it open. Yes, the beds in the standard rooms are very uncomfortable, and are probably the worst beds I've slept on. I was expecting tempurpedic, but I guess the standard rooms have not been upgraded yet. Yes, the A/C unit was extremely loud, it kept the room cool, however, to sleep at night we turned the temp up so it wouldn't kick on as much. The room is dated, but seemed clean. The staff wasn't as friendly as they could have been, but no one was rude at all. The indoor pool was never crowded, even during the storm. The bayside beach was the best part in our opinion. There were no waves and you could walk out several hundred yards and still only be waste deep, so it was perfect for my kids to play in while we relaxed on the beach. We spent most of our time here. The biggest complaint we had was the breakfast buffet. The first 3 mornings, we had a tough time getting food. The main items they had were french toast, bacon, sausage, eggs and potatoes. They were out of all the main items but one. They were constantly bringing items out, but as soon as they set out one item, the people in line took it all. So we all had to eat eggs on one plate, then 5 minutes later we would all eat bacon, and 5 minutes later the potatoes, and so on. Not very relaxing to say the least. Then the 3rd morning was the absolute worst. We arrived at 10:20(open until 11am). They were out of everything but eggs as usual, no surprise. The problem was that the only thing my son can eat off the buffet was bacon due to his food allergies. We kept an eye on the buffet, and no bacon ever came out, finally at 10:40 I went and asked the cook if bacon was coming out. He said no, not at this point. I explained that we had been there 20 minutes and there hasn't been any bacon and that was all my son could eat. He went back in the back and came out like 2 minutes later with a plate of bacon(awesome), but still never provided any to anyone else from at least 10:20-11am. Also on the 3rd day, I found a hair in my eggs when I first started eating. I was done after that even though my family continued to eat. When the waitress came to take my plate, I pointed at the hair and told her about it. She just looked at it with a disgusting look and said "Well it couldn't have come from the kitchen or it would have been short and black" and then took the plate away. That's it, no appoligies or anything. I couldn't demand my money back or anything like that because it was sort of a "free" breakfast that came with my room package. The breakfast was one of the reasons that I chose this hotel so I had pretty much decided after that morning that I would not be returning next year. However, on the last 2 mornings, breakfast was awesome. The waitress even told me on the 4th day, that breakfast should be better today. They had everything fully stocked the whole time we were there and it tasted good. So that gave me hope that those 3 mornings were out of the ordinary. It had nothing to do with the time, because all 5 mornings we ate around 9:30-10:30. I also ate at the seafood buffet 3 nights, I would have eaten there all 5 if my wife had let me. For 17.95 (with coupon) and the convenience you can't beat it. The food was very good and fresh. I've had the seafood buffet at the Princess Royale earlier this year and I don't think I would return there, however this was 10 times better and not expected. I still prefer Phillips for the best AUCE buffet in OC, but they are 32.99 and you may have to wait in a line. For half the price and being in the hotel I highly recommend trying it. As far as noise goes, we never had any issues with the "Seacrets crowd" We were usually asleep by midnight though. We were on the 5th floor, and noticed several other families staying near us. Maybe they try to keep the families up there and the seacrets crowd on the lower floors??? We liked the hotel as a family destination enough to consider it for next year but I will look around more and will be willing to spend more to get a bit nicer place. We enjoyed this stay and wanted to stay another night but they wanted $259 for an extra night. That's about half of what I paid for the week plus no breakfast. I can't see paying that no matter what time of the year it is for this place. The $599 for 5 nights is about the only price that would get me to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kate S
Reviews.Content: This was the first time my husband and I visited Ocean City Maryland. We were looking for a decent hotel for a two night stay. The hotel was conveniently located near the beach (just across the street) and there was ample parking. A few of the staff members were very friendly (particularly on the cleaning staff). The hotel was extremely dated and there was barely any water pressure in the shower. The tub needed to be replaced as it was chipped. We were kicked off the rooftop pool before its official closing time, I believe because the staff and his friends wanted to smoke cigarettes up there. We were the only couple asked to leave with 6 other people sitting up there. We would love to visit Ocean City again, but we will be staying elsewhere. Probably the worst hotel I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “50/50 experience”
Reviews.Author: George M
Reviews.Content: A stay in this hotel was quite terribe due to the inconsistent shower water, it gets either too hot or too cold suddenly and without warning. The room is quite clean though. Need not to mention the old and slow elevators that's servicing the hotel, the elevator hit me twice with its doors. Seriously, this hotel needs a serious modernization. I tried the food in the hotel's bar, it was alright, just that I noticed that the french fries are very dark, they might not change their frying oil that often. The seafood buffet they offered are quite worth the ticket price but some of the food are overnight food especially the fried chicken and shrimps, their texture had changed. their breadrolls are rock hard. The staffs behind the buffet bar are friendly, particularly the asian staffs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in ocean city on bayside”
Reviews.Author: mpierry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend and loved the service! Great amenities, bar and indoor pool. Rooms could have used updating but loved our view. Awesome sunsets!!! Would def recommend this place to others and would def come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Smelly Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BeachBum9817
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were planning a little getaway from Jersey. We loved Ocean City and will definitely come back, however we will not stay at the Princess Bayside. I did not complain to the front desk because I figured there wasn't anything they can do. Pros and Cons below: Pros: -The hotel is right next to Seacrets- best club I've ever been too. -We really liked the pool bar at the hotel. It was in a separate building, but the view overlooking the bay was great. -We always seemed to stumble to Finnigans in the hotel every night. They have some old school arcade games, pool and photo hunt. -The staff was really nice, everyone always said hello when we passed them. One day we didn't get out of the room until 12-1 and by time we came back later on the room wasn't clean. I called the front desk to ask for towels and they offered to send someone upstairs to clean the room. Cons: -The hotel overall has a musty smell to it. -The bathroom in the room was not clean at all. The tub AND the toilet had gross mildew stains that could easily be removed by some bleach. -The floor had all kinds of stains on it. -The blankets on the bed had burn marks on them -We had an iron, but no ironing board. -We did stay up late, however being that the hotel is right next to Seacrets, you will get those occasional people who come home around 3-4 in the morning. I would not recommend this hotel for families. -The walls are paper thin and the doors to the room slam unless you carefully close them, again its very loud at all hours of the day/ night. -The water pressure in the shower is awful and there would be times where we would get a stream of ice cold water then scolding hot water. -The tub is a hazard itself. It dips in the center and has awkward bumps in it. We always had to be careful not to fall. -The air conditioner was set to 67 degrees, however it felt more like 75 degrees. It was also very loud and kept me up all night. -The beds were as hard as a rock, we woke up with back pains every night. -The pillows on the bed were flat. -We ordered room service one morning and it was the worst meal I had during my stay in OCMD.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Aunt_Tamster
Reviews.Content: I am a tough critic when it comes to lodging. I like clean, friendly, comfortable, etc. at a fairly high standard. I booked at Princess Bayside just a few days before my trip. I got a great rate, a bayfront room and wonderful friendly service. The employees were always picking up after things and very service oriented. The rooftop pool was great with views of both the bay and the ocean from the pool deck. Supremely comfortable Tempurpedic beds and a very clean room. The view from the bayfront balcony was gorgeous and the noise level was excellent, even in a first floor room! I felt comfortable, secure and enjoyed my stay immensely.

Reviews.Title: “Good Night's Sleep”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFromPhillyPA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is outdated and the bathroom was small... but the beds were firm and the rooms were quiet. While the first impression is not great it is functional. Spent 4 nights for a softball tournament. Not worth rack rate. Only advisable if you receive a discount.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Tds1983
Reviews.Content: This was our second summer staying at this hotel and we love it. The location is perfect. Plus, the private bay is great for those who do not like the crowds on the beach. The rooms need a little updating, but I describe them as "hotel chic", but no major issues with the room, everything worked and was clean. I do not understand people on here staying the staff was rude, every single staff member from the maid to the poolside bartender were friendly and polite. I also saw the pool being cared for everyday we were there. My only serious issue with this hotel is the elevators! We nicknamed them the elevators of death because the doors close within seconds of opening, and I almost got caught twice by the door. This is very unsafe for those with small children (my friends daughter was 4 and we were terrified of her getting her fingers or arm caught in the door). I beg of the management please do an overhaul on these during the off season. Other than the elevators, we enjoyed the hotel for a second year and look forward to future visits (hopefully with new elevators!).

Reviews.Title: “Pictures on website are deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Betsy M
Reviews.Content: The room had a slight musty smell. The tub was old and looked like it was cleaned with a wire brush which left marks on the tub. The rug ... not the cleanest. When the maid made the bed, she used a sheet instead of a mattress cover. She tucked in so much at the top that there was nothing covering the mattress at the bottom not far from my feet. That's just gross in any hotel. We left the "do not disturb" sign (which is in 3 different languages) on the door on 2 days but the maid still knocked. The toilet sometimes had to be flushed a few times (enough said about that.) The buffet was good but only if you know the trick ... at first we got the prime rib from the buffet pans where all of the food was. It was like leather. We asked the person behind the counter to cut a fresh piece. After all, the prime rib it was sitting next to the buffet under a heat lamp. Apparently this was too much work for him and again, we got a piece that was cut hours earlier sitting in the pan. I explained it was very hard and he said "it's the same meat." After I asked again, he cut another piece. Aside from that, the buffet was decent, especially for the price in OC. The 'game room' was in the restaurant - 3 video games only. The rooftop pool was very nice & the best part of this hotel. (keeping in mind there are 2 buildings to this hotel so you might not be in the same building.) The indoor pool looks nothing like the pics on the site. I asked for a room with cooking appliances. $20 extra per night for a 2 burner "stove TOP", no oven. It was cheaper to eat out! The karoke in one of the restaurant kept my kids up and went on until late. If you need to save $ and don't mind it not being the cleanest, then this hotel can work.

Reviews.Title: “My family and I had a great time for my daughter's dance competition!”
Reviews.Author: Maria R
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying here and it was great. We had an excellent time and the hotel is located in a great spot, near stores, public transportation, restaurants and nightlife - plus the hotel has 2 restaurants. Throughout my stay there the staff was excellent and any problems were handled promptly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff makes for great getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Kent B
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Princess Bayside in July 2012 while attending a dance competition. The staff at the hotel is top notch in all areas and was very helpful. The facilities were a bit dated but were very clean. Overall, the stay was pleasant, especially since the hotel is in such a central location to all the attractions on the Island. I would recommend the hotel, especially the efficiency rooms for anyone traveling with a family. The fridge and microwave made it easy to reheat leftovers for the kids. Can't say enough about the friendly helpfulness of the staff and their quick response to a stuck drain in the shower. Overall great time.

Reviews.Title: “A good time was had by all!”
Reviews.Author: Nathaniel G
Reviews.Content: I really enoyed the stay at the hotel. The scenery was beautiful - overlooking the bay. The accommodations were comfortable and clean. Problems encountered were handeled quickly and amicably. Overall, a short but pleasant stay. Regards the Giles'

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, EXCELLENT food”
Reviews.Author: Sue S
Reviews.Content: My daughter was just married on your beach. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The beach looked great. Everything was planned including a back up room if it rained. Thank God it didnt. Except for a few slightly noisy spectators on the balcony it was beautiful! Afterwards our group(24) went to Finnegan's to eat. This was a last minute decision ,after being disappointed by the nightclub she contacted the previous day.Turns out this worked out in our favor. The food and service were exceptional! Everyone was served within minutes of each other and raved about their choices and the VERY reasonable prices. The food was amazing!!!!! I will be sure to tell all my friends about all your helpfulness. Wish we had a Finnegan's Irish Pub by us!!! Thanks again for everything. Jen's Mom

Reviews.Title: “Ray Rickett and staff shines!”
Reviews.Author: jestermike164
Reviews.Content: Ray Rickett and his staff are amazing. They had a packed hotel that weekend, a bunch of us on motorcycles and the left-overs of senior week. Yet, they treated us purple motorcycle guys like we were the only ones on the property. No request was unreasonable. The staff, Barb at the front desk, the servers and the housekeepers, all very courteous and pleasant. Thanks Ray, and a tip-o-the-hat to your staff-excellent! I'll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Waste of money”
Reviews.Author: Andrea P
Reviews.Content: Check in was awful, the room was non smoking but smelled like smoke, the only good thing was that the private beach was a relaxing touch to end the night. Although it closes at 11pm security allowed us to stay for a moment. The buffet which was the cheapest around and it looked like it had flies all around and no good smells around.. Left fast

Reviews.Title: “Best Time at Princess Bayside”
Reviews.Author: Bentamb
Reviews.Content: I had a nice and easy check in with Barbara at the Front Desk, she was very professional, also later Kara at the Front Desk was nice and helpful. I noticed how bright and clean the hallways were as I went to my room. I stayed in the bayfront efficiency room which I found to be perfectly clean, I think Housekeeping does a great job at this hotel. The room was supplied with everything I needed, loved having the full size refrigerator. It was really hot when we were there but room was really cool, AC was powerful. The room has a view of the bay and looks over the hotel's beach...I can see why people choose to have weddings on this beach, it has palm trees and flowering plants and seems like a perfect wedding site. I was surprised at how content we were just to stay around the hotel, there was so much to do that the idea of getting in the car and in traffic was unappealing. With the beach, the 2 pools and water sports plus being able to walk to the ocean and Seacrets there is no need to get in the car during your stay. Had the best time and recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Average beach hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneinMD
Reviews.Content: Your basic average beach hotel in Maryland. The efficiency room was fine, fully equipped, but nothing special. Not the cleanest place, I am a little afraid to walk barefoot, but I have to confess, that's been true in hotels far nicer than this one. Service was fine - not rude front desk at all, actually quite friendly. Older hotel, very little lighting in bathroom, super loud AC, but ocean city isn't really a luxury destination.

Reviews.Title: “Princess Bayside”
Reviews.Author: Kim K
Reviews.Content: Omg...the staff is excellent and very friendly!!!! I've been staying here for the past 5 years (holiday weekends) and will continue to stay! I always get the Bayside Efficiency room and its worth the extra money for the view of the bay and the sunsets. Another plus is, thats its around the corner from Seacrets :). Rooms are average but very clean. Anytime I ever needed anything the staff was always there immediately to accommodate me! The rooftop pool was very impressive and clean as well.

Reviews.Title: “Basic room, beautiful sunset!”
Reviews.Author: Yelloh24
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many hotels in Ocean City over the years for Firemen's Convention. This year we decided to stay Bayside and picked this hotel for convenience and price. Our hotel room (Bayside Efficiency) was exactly what I figured it would be. Most hotels have the same layout. The bathroom is definitely smaller than most shower/tub & toilet in one room with vanity & sink in another. Beds have tempurpedic mattresses which my husband fell in love with. The first night we realized very late in the night that there was no hot water. The next morning, still no change. Went to the front desk and by the time we returned, the problem had quickly been fixed and it seemed to work fine the rest of our stay. When checking in, the front desk person ( I believe her name was Kara) was very courteous and patient, as my 2 year old was having a mini meltdown and I couldn't find my credit card. The view is amazing in the morning and at sunset. The beach is smaller than what appears in the pictures, and half the beach seems to be taken up by boats for hourly rent. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, and received good service from all parties involved.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean city hotel review”
Reviews.Author: dahijoka
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this place several times. The location is perfectly placed around the corner from Seacrets (best place on Earth) so you can walk to and from instead of having to take cab. The rooms are average hotel rooms. AC works well. If you get room facing thr Bay you will have a great sunset if you are in the room when the sun is setting. There is a bar in the hotel called Finnegans. Average at best. Convenient for drinks in room The rooftop pool is awesome. During daylight hours up can purchase drinks. Great to just relax. Awesome view of bay. If weather is bad there is an indoor pool as well All in all I recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not sure it was worth the $”
Reviews.Author: princess2854
Reviews.Content: I had one of the larger rooms in the "south building" of this hotel. I will say that I had a great view of the bay from my room, which I guess is what I was paying for. Some other members of my family were staying in the building where the reception desk is located. The "south building" is definitely were you want to be if you are staying here. The main building has an incredibly small elevator with no indicator lights inside, so you have to wait until the doors open to see what floor you are on. That sounds like a silly thing, but I cannot tell you how many people I saw get off on the wrong floor and then have to wait for the next elevator because of it. While my room had a great view, the room itself didn't seem that clean to me. We found a finger or toe nail on the carpet by our couch...that didn't give me a lot of confidence in the cleanliness of the rest of the room. The bathroom is tiny and has one very low watt bulb in it. Showering felt dangerous and a little scary! I might stay here again in a pinch, but I hope to not be back in Ocean City Maryland for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, very friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Princess Bayside Beach Hotel for several days while attending a conference nearby. The Hotel is conveniently located in walking distance of the OC Convention Center. it has a decent restaurant Finnegan's on site and a club Secrets with music and dancing in close walking distance. The room was clean and comfortable, but the best part of all about my stay was the staff. The desk clerks were efficient, friendly and welcoming. I especially appreciated their care after my stay. I was contacted the next day by the hotel security manager Steve. my expensive cell phone and charger had been left behind, and the housekeeper turned it in to security. Steven kept my telephone secure until he very kindly arranged for its return. What a great thing, to be treated so respectfully as a guest!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay”
Reviews.Author: beans12
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from a terrible stay at this hotel. We checked in Saturday, the front desk person said to wait as the only rooms available were on the highway side. She stated later there would be rooms in the back. I gave her our phone # and we waited, well at 6pm, we checked in and were given a front room. That was ok, except she clearly lied to us. It was her suggestion, not mine. The room was terrible and extremely loud. After listening to our neighbors and at 4am, I went down to the main desk to see about checking out. The desk person shrugged her shoulders and said there was nothing she could do. If we did check out we were still going to be charged for 2 nights. I pointed to the loud, vulgar crowd in the lobby and asked if that was acceptable. She again just shrugged her shoulders. I didn't sleep all night. On Sunday we were given a different room. Barbara, the front desk person was NASTY and very condescending towards my husband. Our new room was one floor up and right next to a security room. We heard a slamming door about every 20 minutes all night long.Another sleepless night. We also both woke up to red bites on our body. This is unfortunate that the hotel staff refused to acknowledge our very valid complaint. There are many better hotels in this area. DO NOT stay here. Thanks for reading the review and I hope you enjoy your visit to OC MD.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Guests”
Reviews.Author: Joanne S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I attended a wedding at the Princess Bayside and also stayed there for the night. Everything was wonderful. The food was good; hotel clean; staff friendly and helpful. Charlotte and Barbara were especially courteous and helpful, and we appreciate their kindness.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: BigCitySykesville
Reviews.Content: I was hauling a 24 foot trailer down to Ocean City for Spring Bike Weekend and was checking hotels to make sure I had the room to park and to turn. I talked to Steve Manzione, the night manager, and he assured me that he would see to it that I would have no trouble. When I arrived, I drove around the back and could not proceed farther due to parked cars. Steve and 2 others came out to help me back out and to use a spot that I was not sure I could use. The next morning, there was a vehicle parked illegally behind me so that I could not remove my vehicle from the trailer. Steve and another man came out again to assist me.. I really appreciate the helpfulness and kindness shown to me by Steve Manzione and his staff to make sure my stay was uneventful.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: I have been going to the Princess Bayside for 5 years as a part of a golf trip and I always have a great time. Finnegan's is nice and the hotel is right next door to Seacrets. This year, I accidentally left my Garmin GPS in my room and feared that it would be lost forever. I called the hotel to report my mistake with little hope that I would ever see it again. Instead, the head of security took my phone call, searched my room and found the GPS within 20 minutes. He then arranged to have UPS deliver it to me within 2 days. Thank you Steve M.! Instead of just promising good service, they delivered good service.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay”
Reviews.Author: Jamie_CM
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 3 times and each time it gets worse. I've always gone for the 4th of July. This is a party destination for young people. Last year a group of guys threw furniture off of the balcony almost damaging cars below. I'm guessing the same people threw food in the hallway too. I felt terrible when the staff had to clean it the next day. Another night I woke up to the fire alarm. Someone pulled it and the entire hotel had to evacuate and wait for clearance. It was probably 4am. This hotel is very close to Seacrets nightclub. The rooms are definitely outdated but you're in a beach town so I doubt you're going to find anything modern or trendy. It is pretty expensive for what they offer. You're only given one parking pass per room. The only reason we stay here is because it is convenient. There are some good things: There is a good size pool on the roof with a bar, and the staff is nice. There is a great view of the fireworks from the roof too.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need if you don't plan on spending a lot of time in the room.”
Reviews.Author: ankurtz
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Princess Bayside twice - once for St. Patrick's Day and mostly recently for New Year's Eve. The hotel is a little dated but fairly well maintained. It is decorated with all of the seafoam green and coral colored furniture and beach scene paintings you'd expect, but for someone that doesn't spend a lot of time in the room it fit my purposes quite well. I really appreciate that the rooms have mini-refrigerators and microwaves, as I drink a lot of water and like to bring back my leftovers for lunch. I usually stay on weekends so I haven't had a chance to experience their breakfast. The pool looks nice but I haven't used it. I also like that there is a bar downstairs, although I always walk over to Seacrets for my evening entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Eh...I won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: aamip
Reviews.Content: The view from our room of the water was lovely. The private beach is tiny tiny, but there are nice watersports being offered and kids could play in the sand. It is a short walk over the main drag to get to the beach. The crowds hanging around at night are not the greatest. Loud drunks. It is near a large club, I forget the name now. The rooftop pool, again more of a college scene--great fun if that is what you are looking for, but kids with beer bongs in the pool and ripping wall paper from the walls at night. The hallways had a very funny smell, but to be fair that might have been cleaning agents. A pick on my part. I listened to favorable reviews and chose to ignore negatives and that was a mistake in the instance. This is not a great hotel and I would only say stay here if you are looking to party with the younger set, even at early thirties I felt too grown up for the crowd.

Reviews.Title: “StoneHouse golf outing”
Reviews.Author: Howard D
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best outing that we have had. The Princess Bayside Staff took extreme care to ensure that our group was without any needs. Each of our golf members had nothing but good things to say about their rooms and the quality of the hotel. I highly recommend it to other golf organizations.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jerome W
Reviews.Content: Excellent, spacious, and well decorated room in a great location with wonderful view of the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Thieves”
Reviews.Author: Jamie M
Reviews.Content: Me, my sister, and a few friends were staying here to celebrate my sister's birthday. We didn't need a fancy room or anything so the fact that the hotel needs alot of renovations didn't bother us. The problem is that we put a "DO NOT DESTURB" sign on the door and the maids came in while we were out and stole $500 dollars out of my sisters purse. We called the cops after the hotel staff were completely useless and the cops said there was nothing they could do. I will never stay at that dirty, rundown, theiving hotel. Worst hotel experience of my life!

Reviews.Title: “Home Run”
Reviews.Author: JerseyShoreRayV
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Princess Bayside for a weekend during the busy summer season. Professional staff, clean rooms and an added bonus, fun public transportation are just steps away from the hotel which made our stay a Home Run! We'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cheryl t
Reviews.Content: convenient location, comfortable setting, and competitive pricing

Reviews.Title: “HJ2011”
Reviews.Author: Heather J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love the princess Bayside.It is always clean and comfortable.We don't have any problems there.We love the jacuzzi suite rooms,that's the only kind we have ever stayed in.We got married in May 2011 so we stayed there right after.Love the place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Accomodations for the price...”
Reviews.Author: pat74miller
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here two years in a row as part of a golf vacation. Stayed in both buildings, one contains standard rooms, the bayside buildings contains suites and efficiencies. Both buildings have clean rooms and good accommodations. Hotel is within distance to many restaurants and establishments; always a plus for a golf vacation. Hotel was able to link our planned trip with a side trip made by a few members heading down a day earlier. In all, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Spot!”
Reviews.Author: SummerGirl247
Reviews.Content: This is my second year I stayed at the Princess Bayside Beach hotel and I have been highly satisfied. The room is clean and spaceous. They have an excellent rooftop pool that is clean, plays music, and serves drinks. I would definitely recommend going to Finnegans downstairs for their happy hour specials on drinks and their wings. Their wings are delicious. Another plus is that it is right next to Seacrets so no need to take the bus or cab. Finally, the beach is right across the highway... just steps away!

Reviews.Title: “Always stay here....”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: Every year I have a conference at the convention center in Ocean City, MD and for the past 5-6 years I have stayed at the Princess Bayside. While not fancy, the rooms are always clean, comfortable, and well maintained. The staff is always friendly and professional. I will, most definitely, stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Scotts Wedding Stay”
Reviews.Author: Robin M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Princess Bayside to attend my sons wedding which was held at the beach club accross the street. It was a great stay. The staff were helpful and friendly. The only drawback was the parking. we had 2 cars but could only get one parking permit. the other car we had to park on a side street. We used the pool bar and the pub off the lobby and had great service! I would definatly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: pam f
Reviews.Content: The Princess Bayside is a place where you can feel special, because the people that work there make you feel that way. The rooms are lovely and the view of the bay is beautiful in the morning when the sun is coming up. They take good care of the grounds and make the hotel a beautiful place to stay at. The staff is very friendly and will go out of their way to make you feel at home. I have been bringing my youth here twice a year for a conference since 2004 and we will continue to stay here for many more years to come. It's like our home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “a great weekend away !”
Reviews.Author: stephen m
Reviews.Content: having been to ocean city before, i knew that princess bayside offered the best accomidations at a very reasonable rate. the rooms are always clean and well appointed, the staff is polite and ever helpful. it is the only place in ocean city i'll bring my family to.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok, nothing that special.”
Reviews.Author: IheartMD
Reviews.Content: We arrived in OC early on a Saturday morning. After a long drive, we were hoping to possible check-in early, but our room was not available (the family staying in it requested a late check-out which backed us up). So we changed and went to the pool (which is rooftop and really nice!) It had a great view of the bay. The only bad part was you had to walk a ways to get to the building that the pool was on and then take the elevator all the way to the top. Then you got up to the pool and there was no bathroom, so you had to get back into the elevator and go down a floor to find the bathroom. And just so you know, there is only one bathroom that we could find on the 5th floor and it has a handicap sign on the front and there are no signs telling you where the bathroom is so good luck! After the pool we laid out at the bay (not that many chairs so bring your towel to sit in the sand). I really like the bay area because there are no waves and it is very relaxing. You can also rent kayaks, paddle boats, everything right there behind the hotel...very convenient! And the front desk will give you coupons for it. We finally got to check in at 4:05 (late!) Our room was ok, nothing special. Really old tv, couldn't even hook up a DVD player to it. Shower had no pressure and if someone else was taking a shower on the floor then the water would not get hot. The really bad part about the room was that their was no balcony :( We love to hang out on the balcony and read :( Anyway, the walls were paper thin and drunks coming from Seacrets would wake us up at 3-4AM screaming and running down the hallway for HOURS! I couldn't believe that hotel security didn't say ANYTHING to them! I really think one of the managers was from Jersey and so were the drunks so they were probably buddies. By the second night, I had enough and called security myself. They are lucky I didn't just call the cops because it went on ALL night! All in all, GREAT LOCATION (one block or so from Seacrets and so close to everything else!) We might stay there again if the price is right, but probably in a bayfront room so we can have a balcony. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Second visit and looking forward to my third”
Reviews.Author: Bryan O
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Princess Bayside two times during a conference in Ocean City and have enjoyed it both times. It is conveniently located to everything OC has to offer. The hotel staff is very friendly, the rooms are clean and comfortable. The hotel is a bit older, but seems to be pretty well maintained. I have had no issues either visit. I look forward to going back to the Princess Bayside for a vacation when I can take advantage of its closeness to the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Looking Forward To Stay”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaJacobs
Reviews.Content: I am looking forward to staying at this hotel during my upcoming business trip,Sept 17-19. I've been to O.C. many times, this will be a first in the Princess Bayside. I've based my review this far on the ease of booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: magnusj
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have been to this hotel. The last time was two years ago. This time we were given a great deal for a five night stay. The staff is very friendly and cannot do enough for you. The location is great. To the negative, I must say that there have been no improvements to their facility since our last stay and things are showing wear and tear (carpet, walls, tiles). The bedding was just okay. I wish I had brought my own pillow. They did have an elevator issue but fixed it right away. If you aren't concerned with perfect everything, it is convenient to the beach and to restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely Return”
Reviews.Author: KingsGrad10
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Princess Bayside in Ocean City, MD for 2 nights. We were able to check in early, which is always a plus. We stayed in a suite which was very comfortable and clean. They have a pool on the roof with a tiki bar. There is also a bar called Finnigans attached to the hotel. It was in a great location in terms of restaurants and beach availability. The staff was very helpful! If you are looking for a hotel in OCMD, I would definitely suggest Princess Bayside on 48th Street.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING_ DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL_ YOU WILL REGRET IT”
Reviews.Author: adnet
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Princess Bayside a couple of times a year for the past several years and this past stay was so awful that we are never going back again! The hotel management was absolutely terrible and definitely does not care at all about repeat business or customer satisfaction! For $250 a night, you would think differently. With so many other locations available in OC, why would anyone consider giving these money grubbing idiots a chance to ruin their vacation and yes, they did RUIN ours! Never ever again are they going to get that chance! I have also reported them to the Better Business Bureau for changing the price on us at the last minute when we were already at the hotel and had basically no choice but to stay. If you do stay there- be careful- you can't use the beach at nights- Friday or Sat because of the pitiful weddings they have there-seems all they are about and not the rest of the entire hotel there!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Comfortable and A Great View”
Reviews.Author: jlee4777
Reviews.Content: After Expedia screwed up our reservation I found a nice clean hotel with tempurpedic beds and cold air conditioning. The hotel room had a great view and the staff was very courteous. The hotel also offered us a better rate than Expedia, I will definitely recommend calling direct to make a reservation and Thank You Princess Bayside hotel for making my vacation worth while. -James Lee

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, ants and they don't care”
Reviews.Author: Kily_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights (which was three nights too long). The first evening I arrived, just before bed, I spotted ants on the bedside table and on the wall behind it. I went down to the front desk to inform them. I was told someone would be right up. When housekeeping arrived they sprayed the table and wall with something, wiped it down, said that should take care of the ants and they could use something stronger but it would have a big odor. The second night seemed better at first. I spotted one ant. Ok, I will deal with one ant, but then we had a storm come through. Rain was leaking into the room between the ac unit and the wall above it. I called the front desk, the clerk was very abrupt and said he would send someone up. They came. I showed them where you could actually see light coming in from the outside where the rain was leaking in. They vacuumed the water and asked if I would be going out because in order to fix it properly, they would have to pull the unit out. O.k., where is the part where they just offer to give me another room? (By the way, the room was facing the highway which, between the cars and people screaming, was very noisy). Third night, I wake up to a stinging/biting sensation on my face. I put my hand up and what do I find....an ant! At this point my patience is gone. I go down to the front desk and ask to see a supervisor. After being told one is not on duty, I explain the ordeal I have been experiencing and ask for another room and the clerk (who is not very friendly) gives me another room and tells me if I have any other complaints I can make them at 7 am. I move to my new room only to have to deal with hearing the guests next door talking, etc until 2 am. I wrote a letter to the hotel once I returned home explaining what I experienced and I haven't received a response yet. Note: one positive - all of the housekeeping staff were friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: joyfulgirl2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our short stay at the Princess Bayside. We were concerned that it might not be as nice as the website claimed, but it delivered. Our room was very clean and had a fully stocked kitchen, where we cooked crab and enjoyed it from our balcony! We really liked how the hotel employees students from around the world to help with their busy summer season. We enjoyed talking with the Irish restaurant staff and Swedish man who checked us in at the front desk. While it's not an oceanfront hotel, we didn't feel slighted but spoiled being sandwiched between the peaceful bayside and roaring ocean! The city bus stop is right in front of the hotel and for $1 you can ride all the way down the strip and not miss an inch of the boardwalk. We only regretted that we couldn't stay long enough to take in more of the local sites, but will definately return to the city and this wonderful hotel. ps. we also liked Anthony's market & wine shop for some tastey groceries to keep in our room, which cut the costs of eating every meal out.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking end”
Reviews.Author: jbala01
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. The nicest thing was the location. Restaurants clubs beach 2 min away. There was security 24hrs a day. My only dissapointment was the so called Front Desk Manager. Wow what a misserable piece of work. Rude and completely unprofessional towards the desk employees and the tone of voice on the walke talke she used while in front of us not called for. If she talks about and to employees this way how does she treat guests. I think her name is barbara? either way very rude and her hygein practice needs work. Bad breath and unbrushed teeth do not show good representation of your hotel. She is a very unpleasent woman. Because of her actions we will no longer be staying here. Sincerely, Room 336

Reviews.Title: “Too bad this was one of the view hotels available for our last minute trip”
Reviews.Author: DebraandMike
Reviews.Content: There maybe better rooms in this hotel. I will never know for sure because I will not return. We booked a 2 queen suite with bay view but did not receive the view we requested. We were told when we checked in that the view was not guaranteed. We did get the two queen beds but with a view of the air conditioning units. That was OK. We did arrive late, around 10:30 PM (even though our room was prepaid.) The rooms are in serious need of refurbishing. The tub is stained and chipped beyond acceptable. The drawers in the dresser looked as though someone had put wet clothes in the them as the bottoms of the drawers were very damaged. I did not want to put my clothes in the drawers and left everything in my suitcase during our stay. The bed was comfortable but the bottom sheets were not fitted so you end up sleeping on the mattress which is a pet peeve of mine. The air conditioner in the room was extremely loud and made it very difficult to sleep. The walls were very thin which made me not want to even talk in my room as I could hear every word from other rooms and I did not want the neighbors to hear my conversations. The breakfast buffet was $9.95 per person and was acceptable for one day but not enough variety for more than one morning. There was not an option to order from the menu. The final straw was when we checked out at the front desk. One of the front desk ladies, started berating another front desk person in front of 3 groups of guests over a phone call from a prospective guest who was questioning a rate that had been quoted. The climax was when the older front desk person started yelling at the customer on the phone and hung up on the customer. I have stayed at the sister hotel to this one, Princess Royale and loved it! I thought this hotel would be similar but it was not even in the same league. Too many nice hotels at this beach to ever consider staying at this again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: 88ashley88
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our room and our stay at Princess Bayside. The room was very clean. The staff was very nice. It's within walking distance of all of our favorite places to go.

Reviews.Title: “A stay that I Will never forget.”
Reviews.Author: Super-Cruiser623
Reviews.Content: During our recent trip to Ocean city, my family and I stayed in that hotel (Princess bayside, 48th St and Coastal Hway) Room 441. During the first night, we went to bed at around Midnight. But at around 3:00 AM, people sleeping in one of the beds woke up soak by a stream of water coming from the room right above us . It was not just a leak. The stream was about the length of the queen size bed and it came down only one side of the bed. It was bad. I called the front desk who then sent their security guard to investigate the matter. He then told me that the people in the room right above me, who was latter evicted, was using the jacuzzi and did not turn off the faucet not untill their room was flooded. Then I was offered, another room but I insisted to keep the c room with the flooded bed until morning since It would have been difficult to drag the kids off the bed at this time of night and beside it would have taken a long time to move out stuff to the new room. For all the inconvenience and trouble, the General Manager of the hotel at first offered to buy breakfast for my family. But we rejected it because, although it was a nice gesture, the trouble and inconvenience outweighed the compensation. Then, he offered a $ 50.00 discount from the $210.00/per night and late check-out. We rejected it again. Anything equivalent to at least one night stay, ie., credit or a voucher for future travel, would not compensate for all the inconvenience and trouble but would have been a much better options but did not happen. In the end we left the hotel very upset and have no plan to ever stay there again. The replacement room had its share of troubles too. We had to make a few phone calls to the front desk for service. First water in the sink was clogged, then it was the iron board that had a broken leg, and the stove would not work. The AC/Heating is placed right above one of the bed and was very noisy at night and had to be turned off. The management team, including the GM do not know how to make things right even after several attempts. That is bad customer service, right there.

Reviews.Title: “Seemed just like a welcome visit to a friend's home.”
Reviews.Author: wcmjresq
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out I felt just like I had been welcomed into the home af a friend. The check in was friendly, welcoming, and quick. The information about the amenities and services was accurate, and inviting. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was helpful and caring. The Lounge and Restaurant were comfortable and happy places and the drinks and food excellent, and served with care. The check out made you want to return as often as possible. I have stayed at many places in O.C. and I choose this as the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great value on a short weeknight stay”
Reviews.Author: thetravelingcpa
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a Sunday night, tacking on two days at the beach to another trip. Princess Bayside offered us a great rate (using an online coupon) for a Sunday night stay for our family including two boys ages 10 & 12. The hotel was very clean and the service excellent although they were somewhat confused by our coupon. Eventually they made it work. We got an efficiency room for the price of a regular hotel room. Finnegan's had good food but the service was somewhat lacking even though the place was empty. That's not very unusual in O.C. in June however. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Badkid
Reviews.Content: We stay at PBS along with 6-10 other couples every year on the same weekend. We all meet at Seacrets at noon on the day of arrival, so being right next store is very convenient. We also love that we can sit out front and watch the cars drive by; since we're down there during the car show. We've been doing this for over 10 yrs now and never bother looking for another hotel, because we don't have any issues with PBS. The beds are comfortable too - that's a plus!!

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay at Princess Bayside again..”
Reviews.Author: Deena0401
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Princess Bayside in June for 5 days, 4 nights for my brother's wedding. My entire family stayed at this hotel and you would think the staff would group us together, not the case. Some of the family and friends were placed in the bayside building, which had a bay view balcony. Our room was small and right on Coastal Highway. If you're not drunk, good luck trying to fall asleep. The noise is outrageous. In our room, we found an empty beer can in a drawer and a clump of hair stuck to the wall in the shower. We went down to nicely request someone clean our shower. So, they sent up a chatty housekeeper who actually admitted she had cleaned our room before we checked in. We went to the beach and upon arrival back to our room, to our surprise, the hair was still in shower. Again, we went back to the front desk. Well, the man at the front desk decided to act as if we should expect this and someone would be right up. No apology. It's pretty awful that staff looks at young people and just thinks we're 18. This is not the case. I felt so awful that I even recommended this hotel to other family and friends to stay here. I will never be back, ever. I would NOT recommend staying here! There's plenty of affordable places close to this and close to everything you need in OCMD! Keep looking!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kelly A
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Princess Bayside in May and it's a really nice and clean hotel. Our room was really nice and big and was facing the water on the beach so the view was amazing! The beds are SO comfortable, they have those soft tempurpedic mattress's I think and they are just so comfy! The staff was really nice, the maid service was great and each room has a kitchen with an ice maker so that was really nice not having to leave the room all of the time to grab ice. They also have a huge parking lot, part of which is covered. We didn't get to go into the pool on the roof because it was chilly but it looked really clean and nice as well. If you are going to OCMD I definitely reccomend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “****please please read b4 staying here ****”
Reviews.Author: Sampson69
Reviews.Content: I found this place online and this looked beautiful from the pictures, when we got there we found out we were staying in the neighboring hotel from 1963, false advertising?! When we got to the room we noticed holes in the comforter and holes in the walls. Within 10 minutes of being there Big Tony head of security(9yrs on the job) and his minion said there was a report of more than 2 people staying here. Immediately they needed $40 for more people there and Ids. They treated like we were 18yrs old on senior week and were yelling they had seen it all and we weren't gonna pull a fast one on them. The final straw was we were gonna cancel our room for the 2nd night at the front desk. Here is where we met the meanest woman general manager this side of the baybridge! Before we could finish our sentence she yelled at us we knew what we signed up for! I then asked her is she always this rude to people because the 2 days we were there she treated us all like garbage!! The only upside to this hotel was Brianna in the bar who was very friendly. Even if hurricane Katrina hit OC I would never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Never coming back.”
Reviews.Author: Starbrighttt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a family wedding on the beach... the wedding itself was fantastic, but this hotel was certainly not worth the price. The first room that we stayed at had a nice view of the beach, but the hairdryer didn't work, the phone looked like it was from the 60's, the blankets were scratchy and not clean... but it didn't seem so bad until we found out that there were bugs in the bed. Tons and tons of little black beetle-like things were crawling around on the pillows and sheets.. we didn't even notice until my brother woke up from a nap and had to kill three or four that had already sucked some of his blood. So when we went downstairs to see if someone could do something, we ended up waiting for atleast a half hour for the lady at the front desk to actually acknowledge us because she was to busy arguing with some other customers about how they couldn't use a certain card to pay... once we told her what had happened with the bugs, we had to wait for "experts to confirm that there was a bug problem in the room". She was very rude, but atleast they offered us a new room and a discount... Then later on in the night we went to visit our relatives who were staying in a room nearby on the same floor... it turns out that they had bugs as well and it took about an hour to change rooms... it was pretty much impossible to get to sleep after that. Oh, and also while we were waiting for the elevator downstairs, there was a large group of rowdy people by the bar dry-humping each other and smoking cigarettes (although there are many signs that say smoking is prohibited). Overall, this hotel was definitely not worth the price. they didn't even have a continental breakfast (it would have cost 10 dollars to eat there, so instead we went next door and had a fantastic meal at a fraction of the cost). So if there's anybody out there considering this hotel.. look elsewhere! It's located close to the beach, but that's pretty much the only good thing it has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Not family friendly”
Reviews.Author: kristybell
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying we love the location of the hotel. The staff has been nothing short of fabulous but the distance to Seacrets is an issue if you have a family. We have opted for the more expensive deluxe rooms located bayfront year after year and are continually disappointed by the other hotel guests. The first year we were awoken at all hours by guests coming and going to their hotel rooms. The second year I was awoken at 3 a.m. by someone mistakenly banging on our family's door thinking it was someone else's. Last year I had to explain to my grade-school-age son what a condom was as an empty wrapper was slid under our balcony partition by the guests next to us. Later in the week we had the distinct smell of an illegal substance coming from the same room next to ours. I understand that this property needs to adjust to the local economy, but they really need to pay more attention to the type of visitors coming in and adjust the space to accomodate. If you are looking for a family friendly place on the bay, this is NOT it.

Reviews.Title: “Everything that could go wrong, did.”
Reviews.Author: ammorata
Reviews.Content: When we got to the desk to check in i alerted them that i was expecting a package and asked if i needed to add my name to the room or do anything to receive it and they said it only needed to be addressed to the room number. We went up to the room which was musky, humid and dark, only one lamp worked. The safe was turned around in the closet and unusable. We had to go downstairs anyway, and requested the lights be fixed. They were repaired shortly.... then within hours someone came to remove the safe.... he was to return with a working one. he never did. the doorknob to the closet was broken in the process. We attempted to call down to the desk to request more towels, and discovered the phone jack did not remain attached to the receiver. There was only one working ice machine for all four floors of BOTH buildings of the complex so there was no ice for the duration of our 3 day stay. The day my package was supposed to arrive i went to the desk periodically to see if my package had arrived, and finally after 2 or 3 visits, i was informed that no one would sign for it because my name was not attached to the room despite my request at check-in, resulting in a $39 waste of shipping that had to be returned to my home. To their credit the manager was kind enough to allow us late check-out so we could wait to see if the fed-ex driver was able to return to drop off the package, which he was not able to and there was no way for us to get to the pick-up center. we were charged the room safe fee, even though there was no room safe. I had fun bonding with strangers in the parking lot (as it is non-smoking) over how awful conditions were. The club next door makes it a prime spot for a rowdy crowd, so don't expect a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Long Overdue for Renovation Overhaul”
Reviews.Author: DCFoodista
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed at the Princess Bayside this past weekend. We picked the Princess Bayside because of its close proximity to Seacrets as well as its central location in Ocean City and price in the off-season. Let me start by saying, after spending the weekend here, I inquired about the price of the same hotel room during peak. IN NO WAY would I ever spend more than what we spent ($89/night) much less $300/night during the summer! The Princess Bayside's condition was disappointing (considering I think it is owned and managed by the same company who is affiliated with the Princess Royale). The lobby is permeated by horrible smells of stale cigarette smoke and greasy food from Finnigan's Restaurant which is attached. The elevators are out of date and slow. We even became trapped in one of the elevators on Saturday night - we were staying on level 5 of the main building and the elevator door would not open on level 5. Luckily were able to get the elevator to move back down to level 4 and a staff worker was able to pry the door open so we could take the stairs. The hotel room was nothing to write home about. When we arrived, the carpet was wet. Once we turned the heat on, it did dry out by the second day, but we proceeded to wear flip flops the entire weekend as to not walk barefoot on the carpet. This may have also explained the damp smell to the bedroom. The bathroom was moderately clean on arrival, but we know for a fact the housekeeping staff only replaced our towels in the morning (the sink and bathtub were never washed out). When our towels were replaced, they weren't even replaced with the same number and we never received clean washcloths. The TV is old and the beds are hard and flat - a far cry from newer flat-screen TVs and updated bedding many hotels have added in recent years. They are also only covered by a poor fitting flat sheet, which didn't scream sanitary with the outbreak of bedbugs in hotels. If you can get past the lack of cleanliness, DO NOT expect to get a quiet night's sleep. The walls are paper-thin and you can hear every conversation (an extracurricular activity) occurring in the room next to you. Furthermore, we were kept awake both nights until 4 a.m. by other hotel guests screaming, talking loudly, laughing and slamming doors. Save your money and spend the extra $40/night to stay across the street at the renovated Quality Inn. I won't be returning to Princess Bayside unless they follow through with a much needed renovation, housekeeping improvements and a better ventilation system.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for friendly service, find someplace else.”
Reviews.Author: Mywifeandkids
Reviews.Content: Planned a last minute trip their with the wife and kids and from the website, it looked like a great place to stay. HOWEVER...once we arrived, the parking was next to impossible. The front desk girl was rude to my wife and asked that we quiet down our 11 month old (who had been in the car for 6 hours). We stayed in a "suite" with a bayside view (which was beautiful) but the room was anything but a suite. 2 double beds and a pullout couch (which didn't work), a VERY tiny kitchenette and a small bathroom does not constitute a suite. After settling in, we got a knock on the door from maitenence, saying we had to move rooms since our shower was leaking into the rooms downstairs. He told us we had 30 minutes to get out and no staff offered to help get luggage for 4 people and a pack and play to the new room. The rooftop pool was great...the food was subpar at the restaurant (the server was nice) and the "gameroom" was located in the bar which I don't believe is appropriate for a 6 year old. The best part (being sarcastic) was to use the computer in the lobby, you had to pay for it!!! For $289 a night, find someplace else!

Reviews.Title: “Not Much Has Changed In Three Years”
Reviews.Author: Andi21
Reviews.Content: I wrote a lackluster review in 2007 and not much has changed. I have to say - the same fabulous manager is still there - she is so friendly and always happy to help. We stayed here twice in 2010 (August and October) because of the proximity to the beach and also Seacrets. In August, we stayed in a double room (in the main building) and it was comfortable and simply a place to sleep. In October, the off-season, we stayed in a bay-front room. It was nice/comfortable and clean- no frills. Only one minor issue: had to call the front desk because the safe didn't work...as well as a few lighbulbs in the room. Security came quickly and told us how to "work" the safe. It seemed like it had been cracked...the number pad was not attached to the wiring - I am sure they have replaced it by now. Everything else was fine and we didn't have to call again. Not many people staying in the hotel that weekend and it was serene. Restaurants that we really enjoyed: Shark on the Harbour, Sunset Grille, Harbourside Bar and Grille, Bayside Skillet, and Kirby's.

Reviews.Title: “Princess Bayside is the ultimate in luxury!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel42374
Reviews.Content: The suite was roomy.It included a kitchen with stove,microwave,coffe pot,and dishwasher.The view of the beach and the ocean was beautiful.The staff were very friendly and helpful.If you are going to Ocean City MD Princess Bayside is the only Hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “good deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: watts0925
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel clean and staff very friendly. It could be rated over-all as above average for Ocean City, Maryland hotels. Of course, this was in the off-season, so I cannot comment as to what an in-season experience may be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: woodson_al
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay in the middle of all the action in OC. A little pricey but I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If location and cleanliness are important- this is the place”
Reviews.Author: TACBAC
Reviews.Content: The staff of this hotel is very friendly, works hard. They were constantly cleaning something and the housekeeping staff responded to our requests. The sunsets are beautiful, short walk to the beach. We had the pool to ourselves every morning- it was clean and warm. Decor is slightly outdated but again everything is clean. I would recommend a room away from the elevator. A great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “You were the one to upgrade our room, why should we pay more?”
Reviews.Author: martha987
Reviews.Content: The pull out couch bed was broken and extra sheets had stains on them. We called the front desk and they moved us to a new room (bay front upgrade). After we checked out all of the beds in the new room and let the front desk know that everything looked good, they tried to charge us additional $30/night for the upgraded room. This was their mistake and they wanted us to pay extra. According to the guy helping us, the manager wasn't in until the next morning, but luckily "Security" was in the back room and brought the guy that screwed up into the back room. When they came out, the "security" man told us that unfortunately the upgrade was not available for our entire stay. So they gave us a credit for the extra charge they wanted to charge us and a few free breakfasts and drinks at the on-site restaurant. This mishap caused us to miss our dinner reservation and the Bachlorette was very upset. The new room was fine, but he should have just given us that room in the first place!!! Then we wouldn't have had a problem. On the other hand, it is in a great location! Just 1 block from Seacrets and not too far from other great places like Fager's Island. Liked that there were 2 pools, one inside and one outside on the roof. The pool side bar was not open when we went up to the pool on either Friday or Saturday. The food in the restaurant was pretty good as well. The beds were really comfortable. Negatives: there is only 1 ice machine on the third floor of the check-in building and our first room did not have an icemaker in the frig. The second room did have an icemaker. We found left over goldfish crackers on the floor in the room. When we checked out, it was raining and the parking lot where you come out of the hotel with your luggage was completely flooded (looked like a lake).

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!!!”
Reviews.Author: snarfvader
Reviews.Content: We arrived, front desk staff was less than friendly, got to our room(2pm) and the air conditioner did not work at all!!! Not sure how long it took to fix because we left for the evening. Air conditioner was working when we got back around 11pm. Turned the TV on to fall asleep and by 11:15 we had two security officers at our door for a noise complaint! Please note these TVs are all of 13 inches and don't produce more sound than the air conditioner itself!!! AWFUL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Policy”
Reviews.Author: reyowell
Reviews.Content: My daughter and husband had reservations for a night at this hotel. My son-in-law passed away unexpectantly. I tried to cancel thier reservation 6 days early. The hotel policy is no refunds without 7 days notice. I understand that policy is policy, but sometimes a heart is necessary. It appears as though this hotel does not.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, but you pay the price”
Reviews.Author: PAMan804
Reviews.Content: The Princess Bayside is fairly close to the Ocean City Convention Center, and is right next door to Seacrets (the hottest beach bar on the East Coast). Compared to other area hotels, the prices are very reasonable. Of course, there are trade-offs. There is plenty of water pressure and hot water, but the shower head is so restricted that your shower will be a dribble. I reported this to the front desk after my first night, but the fix was almost imperceptible. The AC kept the room cool until about 3:30 AM, then seemed to take a break. Each night I was awakened at 3:30 AM because I was too hot, then a half-hour later because I had kicked the blankets off and was now too cold. This cycle continued until I gave-up at 6 AM. Hallway noise is a serious problem. Each room door slammed, and the noise would wake the dead.

Reviews.Title: “rip-off”
Reviews.Author: Rosewards
Reviews.Content: went for a week-end, way over priced. Elevators out of order, mattresses very firm. Way too noisy all night. I agree--Jersey Shore could film here. Will not stay again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape May Court House, New Jersey
Reviews.Title: “No hot water?”
Reviews.Author: acrossthebridge
Reviews.Content: My fiance spent one Saturday night at the Princess Bayside with friends. They paid premium rates (over $2,000 for four rooms) for a one-night stay, so I was surprised to hear their rooms had no hot water when they went to take showers. I guess they need a larger hot water heater? Not a problem you'd expect at a hotel of this size, and not an amenity anyone should go without - especially for that nightly rate. Too bad they paid in cash.

Reviews.Title: “perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: jeaniegirl
Reviews.Content: A lot of people can say bad things about this hotel but not me or my friends. We stayed (5 girls) in the balcony bay view studio room. it was awesome. the house keeping staff was wonderful and sweet, she even did our dishes!!! our room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. the pull out couch was the best. the balcony gave us added room to spread out and listen to music and sing. it was great. did we hear loud voices, people partying late at night? of course but not so bad we couldn't sleep. the crowd is very young there but we didn't find anyone to be rude.

Reviews.Title: “Shared Feedback”
Reviews.Author: Brandy415
Reviews.Content: My husband and wanted to get away for the weekend. I found the Princess Bay on line, one of the few hotels that had availability the weekend we went. Barbara in reservations, was very polite and professional. The location is great! We loved the private beach! The hotel is badly outdated and needs a major face lift. Its a little over priced for how outdated it is...however we didnt go for the decor of the hotel, but it could use some attention definitely in terms of room decor. And of course its right next to Seacrets so there was a lot of loud guests....which we anticipated. Aside from that we had a lovely time!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sibiker
