Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights ..check in Thursday out Sunday.. staff is very friendly and do their jobs well..pricing is a bit steep..location is perfect for party next door to Seacrets nightclub ..parking is ample and free..both buildings a very clean with staff cleaning throughout the day.. grounds are well lighted and maintained..pool was acceptable, though many of the patio bricks are loose around the decking..a/c pumped cold and was fairly quiet,,bed was mush too soft for my taste.room was clean and housekeeping was very helpful. beverage vending machine on my floor was sold out most of the time. finnegans restaurant on the property was way below acceptable, a/c has been broken for quite some time,and temps in the area can be high 90's and very humid ..service is inexperienced and slow, food order took over an hour.and was wrong when it arrived.bar staff makes up for the situation a bit but , go out to eat or be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “I would certainly stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mimi183
Reviews.Content: I was actually a little worried after reading some reviews but my fears were quickly gone when we walked into our suite (with the mini kitchen). My husband is kind of hard to please and he has been telling EVERYONE what a wonderful place we stayed at. The desk people were great and everyone was very friendly. The ONLY complaint I had was that there was music all the time. The pool on the roof had music going so it was hard to hear your family speaking, there was music in the lobby waiting for the elevator but when you think about the WHOLE EXPERIENCE it was wonderful. I would certainly stay here again and oh yeah the beds with the tempurpedic mattresses Heaven. Thanks Princess Bayside we will be back! My son 15 enjoyed his kayak ride for an hour too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vaction”
Reviews.Author: mommy091
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel,clean room, enjoyed rooftop pool. Staff was very friendly only 2 blocks from beach. Stayed with my 2 young daughtersand they had a ball. Hotel was very affordable and will be staying there again next summer.

Reviews.Title: “RIP OFF”
Reviews.Author: MzMurray
Reviews.Content: I made reservations to stay at this hotel. Two days later, I called to cancel my reservations. I was told by the manager, Barbara, that I would be charged a $25.00 processing fee. I disputed the charges because I had not been made aware of the policy at the time that I made the reservation, and I cancelled more than one month prior to my scheduled arrival date. Barbara told me that the policy is on their website, however could not find it, nor could Barbara the "Manager" direct me to the policy on their website. This is a rip off. I asked Barbara what was the fee for and she replied for processing. I asked her for processing what....hitting keys on a computer.... Again, I feel ripped off. If you are not sure whether or not you want to stay at this hotel--don't make reservations. I believe that the Princess Bayside, and Barbara were made aware of our decisicion to cancel well in advance of our arrival date which gave Barbara ample time to rebook the rooms. Yet, apparently, it is so afraid of losing money that it charges $25.00 to cancel, even though Barbara claims that there is also a 7 day spolicy to cancel. Needless to say, Barbara and the Princess Bayside have not heard the last of me. Next stop I will be disputing the charges with the credit card company. And Barbara said, have a nice day....same to you barbara, same to you.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accomodations and atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: jcipolla3
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, spacious and well-appointed. It was only a two night stay, so we didn't allow for housekeeping, but they made their presence known and made every attempt to accommodate our needs. The amenities - cabana bar, outdoor and indoor restaurants - were efficient and the food was first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Got a great price for a nice room”
Reviews.Author: shooter2424
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff and great location. I went to Ocean City on a weekday and found this great bargain on line. I paid less than $60 for a night in a very clean, comfortable room overlooking the bay. The sunset was beautiful. Irish bar/restaurant right down stairs and a decent breakfast bar just a few steps off the lobby. Felt safe and secure and will stay again next time I'm in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting rooms, rude staff!”
Reviews.Author: bichonlover2
Reviews.Content: While the price is reasonable, the hotel is dingy. The staff is extremely rude! Not worth it to me. I noticed a few ants on the nightstand next to the bed when I checked in. took care of those few ants and didn't really think anything further about it.... until the next evening that is, when my daughter and I got back to our room there were hundreds of ants in several areas of the room, including the bed. We were disgusted and freaked out. We had to shake out our suitcases and all of our clothes. We immediately called the front desk and asked for a new room. The first new room we were given was occupied, so we had to go back to the lobby and get another room. The next morning when we were checking out, I asked the general manager for a comp because of the inconvenience of the ants and the moving around rooms. I explained that we were upset by the ants and very inconvenienced, not to mention that the ants are unsanitary. The general manager proceeded to tell me that ants are no big deal and they are not unsanitary. He then said I was being unreasonable asking for a room comp and he was giving me nothing. The guy was so disrespectful and rude, I couldn't believe it! I will never stay in this hotel again, and I will also tell anyone I ever hear who is travling to OC to not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jack21903
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel, but the rooms and facilities are kept clean. The rooms are starting to show their age, but still a nice hotel for families or adults. We've stayed several times, and the indoor pool is great for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: beaches8
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have been coming to stay at the Pricess Bayside for the last 3 years. We come to celebrate our birthdays and get away just the two of us. The location is perfect because it is right next to Seacrets which is our favorite place to visit as well as the food at Finnigan's is always excellent. Our room is always clean and the housekeeping personel are friendly. Barbara is our favorite because she treats us like she has know us all of our lives. When we call to book our room she always makes us feel like she remembers us and gets us the exact room we describe to her. We will come to the Princess Bayside every year and are already looking forward to next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price!”
Reviews.Author: oclocal24
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many different places in OC and Princess Bayside gives you the most bang for your buck. Rooms are simple but clean and customer service is outstanding. Located right next to Seacrets and close to many other great mid-town bars and restaurants. Next time you are in OC, try to find a deal here!

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, overpriced, and difficult to deal with”
Reviews.Author: ensignkid
Reviews.Content: Dealing with the Princess Bayside was a waste of a time from the beginning. They took a deposit for a room on a Thursday night and then called us back on Friday morning and canceled it because we wouldn't stay for 3 nights (nearly every hotel had rooms that weekend) without giving us back the deposit. The front desk/reservations manager was ignorant, yelled at us for trying to book the room, and said that '"we are a resort so they don't have to have good customer service." Well, they don't have to have our money either. Stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--Bay/Ocean combo”
Reviews.Author: JBonardi1101
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here and spent all of our time at the edge of the bay. I suggest you splurge for the balcony bay view, if not you'll probably get stuck on the street (like we did) But it is a little overpriced. Great location though, seacrets was fun! Comedy club voucher was good too! Roof pool was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go!!! Rude Hotel Staff is all aout evicting people”
Reviews.Author: russdpipes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bayside princess for my bachelor party on Labor Day Weekend, from the time we walked in to the time we left the hotel staff was extremely rude. I've never seen anything like that, and seemed to receive an attitude from a bunch of people around OC. The hotel front Desk Manager Barbra was the worst, She was condescending to us off the bat as we walked through the door to check in. There was a problem with the way the man over the phone booked the rooms, and she told us we had not paid any money on the rooms, even though my brother paid off the $700 bill the credit card company charged him, after arguing with us she quickly realized her mistake, but her attitude didn't change for the better. Me and my brother and friends weren't hyper or acting crazy like you would probably infer with us being a bachelor party, but we were polite and refrained from causing any problems. That night we returned from seacrets at 2am and admittedly our party was loud for that hour, talking to other guests in the hallway, but nothing crazy and obnoxious. Security came up and was extremely rude in how they told us to quiet down, which we gladly did so not wanting to cause any problems, so we went into our rooms and my cousin let the door close itself ,which if you know hotel doors can be loud, but unintentional, the security guards said we we slamming doors being too loud and told us we were getting an eviction warning. so my cousin signed it we told them we were sorry, and tryed to calm our friends down. we all went to sleep then, but the were four or five other rooms in that hallway making noise and slamming doors. then next morning my two cousins who were staying in one of the four rooms we had booked and paid for for two nights had an emergency and had to leave after one night. the asked if they could get a refund for the night they were staying for at 8am and were denied so they turned their keys in. my brother whose name the rooms were all in found out and asked for the keys back, being they weren't in right to check that room out. after being rudely told we weren't allowed to have the room back even though we paid for it, my brother convinced the desk manager to give us keys back for that room and give two guys in one room their own room. we ate breakfast and hung out at seacrets for the rest of the afternoon until 3pm when we came back in my friend try to get into his room, the key did not work. The hotel security manager told my brother that we were evicted from that room and that they had rented it out to other people, that we had two eviction notices ( we had one warning) and we lost the room even though it was paid for, that we were being too loud last night and slamming doors. ( which other rooms were making much more noise than us) we were told The hotel general manager was not there to talk to he made a decision and left. and that if we want to argue with them about getting our refund or our room back they would evict us all from our other rooms. we called the cops on them and eventually they gave us 66$ of the 178$ spent on the room back, plus the $178 they made by double dipping on one room by renting it out double. If our cousins didn't leave I believe the hotel satff would not have done what they had done and taken our room. I believe they seen an empty room on a holiday weekend and found any grounds to make money off of that. I also heard of other people getting evicted that weekend, and the hotel staff taking the guests valuables out of their room (ie. diamond necklace, jewels) at least we received some of the money back, but DO NOT go to this hotel it is dirty, smells bad and I don't care what the hotel says about their pool meeting health regulations, minimum code is way too often still below par. the pool room is too humid and muggy and smells like feet. it might be clean but it sure isn't pleasant. there is no ventilation in the bathrooms. The hotel staff is the rudest customer service I have ever seen, almost like the soup nazi, or genos or pats steaks in Philly. One thought of advice to the hotel who says they cater to families over people who stay there to go to seacrets. Treat you guests equally, the money is the same. I know families are a different type of crowd than a bachelor party, but learn something about why your guests are coming to stay with you. Try and group familys on a different floor or other end of the hallway from guest taking advantage of you location next to seacrets, that is better business sense than evicting people

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirl003
Reviews.Content: I would stay at the Princess Bayside again. We enjoyed our stay and was very pleased with the staff and how clean the Hotel was.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location with private beach, but VERY dated decor & fixtures!”
Reviews.Author: Thehotelspy_co_uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days on our trip across America, it is a nice location with it's own private beach and roof top pool. However the hotel itself, whilst clean was very dated. The elevator for one, has a mind of its own, and the tiles in the lobby were all cracked. The carpets are tired and worn, especially in our room, the sofa bed was also a bit worn. The Ironing board was rickety and a bit dirty. And a couple of our towels had stains on them. This is not a whinge list, just a few factual observations we made while staying here.

Reviews.Title: “terrible, scamming out of moeny”
Reviews.Author: rosie143
Reviews.Content: We went to OC for a bachealor party, a rather tame and quiet one. My wife and I stayed in the princess royale just the week before spending 1,000 for the weeknd on the room, and my friends and i have been going down for years in a large group and staying at the princess bayside to the amount of approximately $1,700 for all the rooms. This year will be the last though. upon arrival we checked in 2 of the 3 rooms, around 3pm, we did not check in the last room until about 6:50pm, because all the people had yet to arrive. We went out to dinner, and after the rest of our party met us, we entered the last room at 8:15pm upon entering the room there were 2 holes in the wall, clearly there were there before as there was no dust, or dirt on the floor at all. upon calling the front desk to notify them, security and maintaince arrived, they threatened to call the police, and accused us of the damage, we pointed out that there was no debris around and still they insisted if we did not pay the 300 dollars they would have us arrested and everyone else evicted from the rooms. obviously we were cornered into this scam, this price was later lowered but we had to pay cash as credit is not accepted, although we found this all disturbing we had no choice, as the weekend went on ants overtook room, we were afraid we would be accused of bringing them in from elsewhere so we didnt dare complain as it may cost us more money! after several years of staying in this hotel with a large group, and a yearly long weekend with my wife at the princess royale this incident alone, the way we were treated and called liars, the terrible conditions, burn marks on the hair dryers, most outlets not working, lights broken, bugs etc...... it is clear that this will be my last stay at either of the princess resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay overall, some problems”
Reviews.Author: justBeachyOCMD
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel is nice, spacious, and clean. I have stayed here before and always enjoy my stay. The location is excellent within walking distance of great shops, restaurants and right next to Seacrets! However, on this particular trip there were 5 of us sharing and room and on numerous occasions we had to call the front desk to have more towels, washcloths, and linens for the sofa bed. I would recommend this hotel and stay here again, but it is a pain to have to continue to ask for something that should already be there based on the number of guests in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: poohie
Reviews.Content: I would like to preface by saying most hotel rates in OC are ridiculous for what you get and I realize that. Usually we stay at the Best Western just a few blocks away, it's a brand new hotel with spacious rooms and it's less expensive than the Princess Bayside. However, we ended up booking a last minute weekend trip and the Best Western did not have availability. Since we were going to OC primarily for Seacrets we knew this location could not be beat. Seacrets is directly next door. The Princess Bayside does have a great location. Unfortunately that is where the positives begin and end. For starters, the decor is shabby at best. This is not a big complaint to me but I think must be noted considering the competition at this price point does not look as generally run down. This theme extends from the 80's pink Golden Girl lobby to the guest rooms (we stayed in the main building). The 2 elevators are old, tiny, fetid and slow to service the 5 floors. The corridor leading to the rooms on my floor was not ventilated at all and I can only assume the AC unit stuck at the end of the hall in the wall was not operational. Luckily, our room was on the end of the building leaving us with only one neighbor. There was a large gap beneath the door that allowed hallway noise to enter the room. That is another issue, because of the excellent location to Seacrets the drunken circus that plays nightly in the halls is a bit much. I actually watched a person do what I can only describe as somersaults down the hallway one night after dinner and I believe the time was only 8:30 pm. Once liquored up they were a nuisance and quite inconsolable. I would not stay here with children for that reason. Otherwise, the AC unit in the room was also very loud but it was a welcome change from the traffic noise (the room faced the road directly) and sounds from next door. Although I set the thermometer down to 70 it never got very cool in the room. The decor here too is tired and dingy. It did appear to be clean but the shower drain did not do so at all and after a few minutes was very much both shower and bath which is repulsive in a hotel. The sink drain's stopper also appeared to be in a permanently semi-closed position. My friend called the provided hotel hairdryer a relic that she would not risk turning on. We did pass by an indoor pool off the lobby that I believe would have been a health hazard to enter although it seemed quite a few less discerning patrons took this calculated risk. All the staff I encountered were friendly. Check in is at 4, we arrived right at this rush and it was a slow and frustrating experience. I am not a picky aristocrat who thought I was booking a room at the Ritz. All in all it did meet our basic needs but I believe the price should reflect its shortcomings. Even in the world of overpriced OC hotels, there are better options at this price point.

Reviews.Title: “We're coming back next month!!!”
Reviews.Author: avatar1295
Reviews.Content: I have been vacationing down Ocean City, MD since I was a teenager. I have stayed at most of the "known" hotels. This hotel is clean, spacious, friendly, and you can't beat the location. I try to keep it a secret but we seem to tell everyone how nice this place is.

Reviews.Title: “Ray Rickett & his staff ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: jestermike164
Reviews.Content: Always a pleasant experience. The staff starting with the front desk people, the manager, cleaning staff and hospitality staff always great you with a smile and simple "hello". No reasonable request has ever been denied. Accomodations for '"suprises" have been handled positively at the last minute. Good people, great location, what more do you want?

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: seacretgirls
Reviews.Content: Our room was not cleaned properly.When we brought it to the attention of the hotel manager, we were upgraded to a suite, However, the second room although it appeared to be cleaner, a couple of things needed to be corrected. Once we got settled, we had a great time! It is a nice hotel. We would stay there again.....just make sure your room is clean!

Reviews.Title: “The Princess Bayside has it all- location, quality and comfort!”
Reviews.Author: Rubby211
Reviews.Content: The PB is a short walk to Seacret's. The staff is friendly and quick to provide service. The hotel is clean and well kept. There is a nice little restaurant in the hotel and a little cafe right next door. The OC bus runs 24/7 with a bus stop right in front of the hotel. Once we tripped upon this hotel, we haven't stayed any place else!!!

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaKml
Reviews.Content: stayed in an effiiciency July 29th - 31st and had a great time. (room 340) At check in we were mistakenly sent to a room in the main building and I agree, that part of the hotel is pretty musty smelling upstairs. The lobby is nice though ( and clean) and the staff seemed friendly enough. After discovering we had the wrong room type we were sent "next door" to the bayfront building and it was much nicer. Altho I didn't go to OC to cook, it was nice to make pancakes in the morning. They were happy to give us extra coffee so we were all set. The rooftop pool is nice, great view and altho the bar is more of a beer stand type, it is reasonably priced. My only objection to the whole trip was at checkout day. It was 10 after 10 and my beach towel flew off the balcony to the balcony below ours. I called the front desk to see if they could have someone retrieve it for me and the clerk said she would send security to my room to walk down with me. Check out is at 11...At 10 after 11, still no security so I went down to the next floor and looked for a member of the cleaning staff. However, not one of them speaks English that I could tell. So, my towel is gone but someone gained an unexpected souvenier so it's all good. Oh, and the wireless internet worked fine the whole time, no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: magnusj
Reviews.Content: After reading some people's reviews I was apprehensive when we made reservations for this hotel. However, the saying "don't always believe what you hear (or read in this case) applies. Parking was great. Customer service was very good and the employees were very pleasant and outgoing. They couldn't do enough for you. The room was very clean and it was maintained daily. The walls were not paper thin. We were in a regular room with no balcony and it was fine. Whatever was going on out in the halls or in other rooms stayed out there. Never heard a thing. The location of the hotel is great. It is away from the boardwalk and all the craziness of the city, although right next to Seacrets which is a great party place. Bus transportation is only $2.00 a day so hop the bus all day and nite if you would like. Finnegan's Restaurant was just okay. Very quiet during the week. Only one negative thing. The elevators are way too small. Hard to get the luggage vallee into it. That is really not a big deal. I definitely will consider going back to this particular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel until this year”
Reviews.Author: Melissa9819
Reviews.Content: Ive always stayed at this hotel and loved it until this year. I saw on-line that they renovated the pool. When we arrived, all they did was poorly lay tiles around the pool. My daughter cut her big toe twice while only walking because the tiles shifted and moved. I myself almost fell. Also, I pre-paid for our week long stay 2 weeks prior. Upon arrival, the young lady at the front desk swiped my check card, I guess for "incidentals". That same night, I took my family to Seacrets for dinner and my check card was declined, luckily I had cash on me. I called my bank the next morning and they told me that there was a $689.71 charge from Princess Bayside. I went directly to the manager who stated they only charged $1. OMG! I got my bank on the phone and they spoke to Sherrie from billing. Sherrie was helpful. She faxed a letter to my bank stating they charged my card incorrectly. Because of their error, my account was negative for 2 days! I made sure that I was nice to the staff and never got angry like I wanted to. I even called when my money was put back to thank them. Management never appologized, or admitted guilt when it was clearly their fault. I believe that someone at that hotel tried to commit fraud at my expense. You would of thought that the hotel would of offered us something for the inconvenience that they caused. I am so disappointed because I loved this hotel. Great location next to Seacrets, roof top pool(please fix the tiles), Finnigans bar, ample parking, and private bay beach. And because of my principles, I will no longer be able to stay here. If you do, please check your bank account after you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the value.”
Reviews.Author: jelis
Reviews.Content: We liked the location and the pool on the roof. It was clean and the staff was friendly. Would stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room, good customer service, good value.”
Reviews.Author: l00k9999
Reviews.Content: Spend every summer year for several years. Property continues to improve in room cleanliness and customer service. Roof top pool is clean and a great place to relax. Food is good and moderately priced. Right next door to Seacrets!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: KimmyEarlevilleMD
Reviews.Content: Convienient location. Staff very courteous and helpful. The hotel could use a make over due to so many visitors. Nice pricing and value for the $

Reviews.Title: “Great view, Great location, Great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: nyceguy1957
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location in Ocean City. Close to the convention center. Right on the bay, water was great. Withing walking distance to several dining and nightlife spots. Room service could have been a little better, did respond quickly when called. Overall, a great place if you are looking for a great time in Ocean City, MD.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great stay”
Reviews.Author: justj0e
Reviews.Content: Despite the volume of customers, the staff at the Princess Bayside do a phenomenal job making you feel welcome and special. We had a great stay and will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: MariaS22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the weekend of Feb. 28-Mar 1 for the Reach the Beach Cheer Nationals. We had a great time. The rooms were a good size and clean. It was nice to have a microwave and fridge. Most of the staff were very nice and accommodating with our "enthusiastic" crowd! One waiter went out of his way to return a credit card I left behind. It was convenient to have Finnegan's right downstairs for food and drink. Would definitely stay here again. GO TIGERS!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here for a relaxing quiet weekend”
Reviews.Author: MaggieMer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went down to Ocean City for a weekend get-a-way from our crazy hectic lives. We chose this hotel because we had stayed here before on the off season and did not have any issues; and the price was right. This particular weekend was like being in a college dorm again. As soon as all the bars let out at 2am, the drunks woke us up by running around the halls, yelling, slamming doors, and being obnoxious. We called the front desk and security was sent up, but as soon as security was gone...it started all over again. Needless to say, we did not sleep well. The staff was apologetic, but they only had one security guard on duty. The lack of help showed. As for the rest of the stay, the room was clean but the hotel itself was not as clean due to the drunks. It was subpar overall and what one would expect for the price. I would not stay here again and would not recommend it to anyone looking for a relaxing weekend at the beach. Because of the hotel's location (right next to Secrets) I would only recommend it for those who are down there to party.

Reviews.Title: “Incompent staff....Did they even understand english???”
Reviews.Author: bachasez23
Reviews.Content: When booking the hotel, I specifically asked if they had cots for extra people. They never even asked or inquired how many people were staying in the room. After later asking for a cot, they said they would bring one up. Then finally calling a 3rd time we were informed that the hotel does not have cots and that they know that more then 2 people were staying in the room so they would charge us another $15--I am guessing it was for the blanket and pillow they brought up for one of us to sleep on the floor. And after bringing up a blanket and pillow a rude cleaning staff member and night manager stated that they knew more then 2 people staying in the room and that we were being dishonest. Please tell me why no one ever asked us if we had another person staying there during the 3 times I asked for a cot--DUH. Do they need a high school diploma to work there? Apparently not. Also, room price included a pubic hair covered paper towel left from the previous guests.

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient...nothing special”
Reviews.Author: IKE317
Reviews.Content: My wife and i took our 6 yo here for a weekend getaway 9/27-9/29. When we arrived check in was quick and easy. Our room was available approx 2 hours before the 4pm check in time. We were originally assigned to room 301 in the main building. When we walked in there was a strong musty smell. The sink also didnt drain at all. Now we are not picky people, so we weren't horrified or anything, but really didn't want to stay in a smelly room. Had they told us no other rooms were available we'd have been ok staying in that room, but wouldn't have enjoyed it. Fortunately they did have another room, and transferred us to room 511 w/o any problems or questions. That room was better. The decor in the hotel is a bit dated, and the carpet is filthy, but I've been going to O.C all my life and thats usually the case because its hard to get all the sand, and beach funk out of the carpet. No big deal. The sheets were clean, and smelled fresh. there is a small micromave, and mini fridge. We got room service breakfast on Sunday morning just to get it cause it made me son excited to have the food brought to him. I had eggs ,homefries, bacon and toast. Everything was very good. My wife and son got the continental plate, which was bascially juice, and a few mini muffins. Not really worth the price, but we were on a mini vacation so no big deal. During the stay my son had small cups of applesauce to snack on and we forgot to bring a spoon. I went down to the attached restaurant Finnigans and asked if they had a plastic spoon, they gave my a real spoon and said just leave it in the room. very cool. The hotel had security every night we were there. they were usually standing in the lobby chatting with the desk staff. There is an indoor pool, but it wasn't heated, and the ocean was about the same temperature so we didn't swim at the hotel. Overall, the stay was fine. Nothing mind blowing, but I felt safe, and the hotel is at 48th street so its close to the inlet, boardwalk, rides, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: silverbow
Reviews.Content: Again, my husband and I decided to get away for the weekend at the last minute. My husband booked the room for a Friday and Saturday night on Friday morning and had no problems. Staff was friendly and the room was very clean. We were there in December 2007 so the hotel was not busy, so I can't comment on noise, etc. We had one of the jacuzzi rooms and the jacuzzi was large and clean. Loved it! The room was large and I loved the temperpedic bed (very comfy!). We went to Finnegan's both nights. Overall a good time. Friday night we went there to have dinner prior to going to Seacrets. The bartender (wish I knew her name) was great. I even witnessed her politely cutting off one patron who had a bit too much to drink and confirming that another patron was walking before serving him. She very polite and frankly, it was refreshing to see this. (and while the patrons were having a good time, it was nothing "rowdy" or even mildly annoying). Husband and I even played a game of pool - had a good time. Overall we had a nice weekend away. One comment - we had a large balcony but there was no chair/table! Maybe it was because we were there offseason. But, overall we had a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Well Pleased”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel520
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd trip to this hotel with children ranging from 11-3. When we arrived this time we were early and as stated our room was not quite ready, but we were issued a parking pass and told we could use the facilities until something opened. This was a relief to us as well as the children. I returned to check in at 4:00 and was issued a room on the 2nd floor. I had read the revviews prior to coming and was worried I would find some of the horrifying events that were happening to others. But upon entering our room we were quite surprised! It was well cleaned. the rooms smelled fresh and everything looked neat. I was expecting the next 4 days to go down, but it never did. Our room was always cleaned to our expectations. This is saying alot since we had children who carried alot of sand from the beach to the hotel room. We did not experience ants even though we had alot of food stored in the room for the kids to snack on. One of the highlights of the hotel is that they offer boat rentals for a fee to the guests. The gentlman who took care of us, told the children as long as they had no customers for the paddleboats they could use it for the day!! Our kids had a blast. As for the restaurant, I did not care for it. To much fried food offered and the breakfast buffet was not woth the price. Overall I am very pleased with the service we had for 2 years now. Our children love the bay and finding critters, yet they are one block away from the beach which is located right across the street if they want a change of pace. It was great with the gas pricesas well We did not have to travel unless we wanted to go somewhere else to eat. WE hope to return again in the future since our children enjoy staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Dont listen to all the bad reviews STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: verypikytraveler123
Reviews.Content: THIS HOTEL IS GREAT. Upon arival check in was great the staff was so freindly. When we got in our room it was sooooo clean and it looked brand new. The bathroom was spotless.The pool is great and very clean. This location is great. And the buffet in the hotel is soooo good. All the staff here was great and very helpful. This hotel is a great value. so if you are looking for a clean room thats a great value STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “ants had more fun then us”
Reviews.Author: cinderellieus
Reviews.Content: Myself and 2 other girls went to Ocean City from friday to sunday. When we arrives friday night, we took showers and found that the shower trickeled water, the sink wouldn't drain and we could not get 1 of the keycards to work. When we came back friday night there were ants crawling around the side table between the beds and on the 1 bed. We called the front desk and they said they would clean the room in the morning and check to see how things went after that. Saturday we had the same problem and the front desk told us they were sorry but they had no where else to put us right then, rooms were still being cleaned, saturday night we received no response to our complaints again. Sunday morning when we were getting ready to check out, maintenance finally showed up to see what the problem was in the bathroom. When we checked out I spoke to the manager and she said all she could do was refund us $50.00, on an over $400.00 room stay. She did give us the address where we could write a complaint but said they may not do anything. I am appalled at the room situation and more appalled at the lack of consideration from the front desk. Whether the manager was truthful or not, this is unacceptable. We should have been refunded or given compensation for a 2 night stay and a apology.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Families”
Reviews.Author: Silverpink
Reviews.Content: Had an OK time at Princess Bayside over the 4th of July weekend. Would not have booked it based on other reviews, but we were planning a last minute holiday weekend trip, so we did not have many options. Our biggest problem was the noise level. First of all, our room was located directly outside of the elevator lobby. It wasn't the people coming and going that was a problem, it was the contant bell that dinged every time the elevator was in service. Second of all, and more problematic, were the other guests in the buidling. Our next door neighbors were blaring rap music day and night. At one point, they put their speakers out on the balcony and proceeded to stand out there, singing along at the top of their lungs! We were appalled! We called the lobby and they did come right up and give them a warning, but it only forced them to turn it down every so slightly. We were a group of 4 young people; I cannot imagine how upset a family would have been. The decor of the hotel was outdated, but fine. The beds were Tempurpedic and really comfy, so that was a plus. For the price, it's what you would expect, so i can't really complain. My favorite part was our balcony overlooking the bay. I would HIGHLY recommend getting a bayside room. Unfortunately, there are very flimsy dividers between each balcony, so it doesn't feel that private. Plus, if your neighbors decide to put their speakers out on their balcony, you're not going to have a very relaxing balcony experience. Finally, the proximity to Seacrets was a huge plus. It was super convenient to head over there. It was also a very easy walk to the beach. In conclusion, I would rate the Princess Bayside as a good deal - if it weren't for the type of crowd it attracts. If you're going, just cross your fingers that you're going to have decent neighbors. I would strongly not recommend this hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “Had my wedding here”
Reviews.Author: mrscars
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding and reception here. The wedding planner Leslie was great to work with and the rooms were wonderful to stay in. I did have a problem during my reception with the staff being rude to my guests. First of all no one cut my wedding cake. My mother had to do it herself and when she asked for plates and forks to hand it out the first staff person told her no! Then someone went and got it for her. My dad ended up packing up the uneaten cake after having to beg for a box to put it in. Also, the dj called last call and my brother in law went to the bar to get one more round of drinks for his table. He turned around to talk to someone and the server dumped each and every full drink saying it was "time to clean up." Overall I must say the reception was lovely but the waitstaff there needs an overhall in their manners.

Reviews.Title: “Ants, wonky showers, and a clogged sink”
Reviews.Author: shughrue
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip in which I stayed at the Princess Bayside from Friday June 27 to Sunday June 29. A friend whom I was going with ranted and raved about her previous stays at this hotel, especially because it was right next to Secrets. When we arrived, check in went smoothly, our first snag was the parking. It took forever to find a space and we didn't want to park up stairs because of having many bags to carry and you either have to drag them down steps or a very steep ramp. This hotel doesn't seem to offer those rolling luggage carts, and if they do I don't know how since the elevators are much too small. We entered our room, 5th floor facing the ocean, and the first thing we noticed was the peeling wall paper. Touching the walls also yielded a sponge like consistency. We next found ants crawling on the walls, side table and table and chairs. We ignored this as it was only a few and we were ready to party. The shower was so horrible that what would have taken 20mins was much more like an hour. It came out so weakly and wonky that most of it squired up on the ceiling tiles and ran down the outside of the tub. Also the shower no matter what you had it on would go from normal to freezing cold to boiling hot in a matter of seconds. When we went to brush our teeth we found that the sink immediately clogged up for no reason. So the next morning we called the front desk. We explained about the problems and were told there were no rooms to move us to, even though the sign said vacancy the whole time during our trip. He convinced us to let them clean the room and it would be better. Big mistake, we had more ants after they "cleaned" than before. When we finally checked out we were given $50 back and told to write a letter to seek more compensation. There were 3 of us so they can expect 3 letters. I will not stay here again and will warn everyone that I know. I could pay less than $200 some a night for something better on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: OKTRAVEL17
Reviews.Content: I highly advise to not stay at this place. We were guests at the wedding there on the beach. The service was absolutely horrible. They did not take care of the bridge and groom or guests what so ever. They basically set the tables and put out "some" food and walked away. The food ran out and the alcohol ran out 1-2 hours before the reception was even over. There was dirty dishes all over the tables that were never cleaned up. As far as the front desk goes, you don't get service with a smile, you get attitude. The wedding party had dinner at Finnigan's the night before. They were double charging peoples tabs. This happened to at least 4 different people. They would put the same thing on two different tabs and double charge people. The bartendars there were EXTREMELY RUDE. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone, especially if you are planning on having a wedding there.

Reviews.Title: “great location... too much money for the room”
Reviews.Author: kingzyzzer
Reviews.Content: its a great place to to stay if u wanna go to seacrets to party... since its right next door... other then that i paid 250 for each night.. n i got a deal .... the rooms r not that great kinda small... but if u get the rooms on the bayside... it was very nice to wake up to.. n look out over at sunset... very beautiful...

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive just for a hotel room”
Reviews.Author: steelkaya06
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the room were nice. We had a small kitchen in our room and a Bayview. It was spacious and clean. However the breakfast which was included to the rate was nothing but a poor meal. So we went to another hotel for breakfast after the second day. The hotel is on anice location and it was kept clean and well maintaned but we found it way too expensive although that was the cheapest one we found in the city. We're unlikely to return to Ocean City but if we do we may have to stay at this hotel again just because the others charge a fortune. Oh also the hotel charges $10 a day for internet service!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a horrible weeend!”
Reviews.Author: Dixiegirl41507
Reviews.Content: I stayed at your hotel for Winterfest 2008. I had the expectations of staying at a nice,clean hotel with a bayside view. I did not get that. Instead I got a very dull and dingy room with bugs on the bathroom floors, not enough towels nor wash clothes,a noisy heater,no hot water to take a shower,and loud people in the hallways. I called to the front desk to get extra towels and wash clothes and they said they would bring it up but that never happened. Two days in a row I had to go without taking a shower for the lack of hot water. The hearter was very noisy but helped to cut down the noise in the hallway. I know services didn't get over until late but I think they should have enough respect for the other people sleeping at night and in the mornings. I did not like the door knockers. Saturday morning my youth leader had to go out into the hallway at 12:35 a.m. and tell the other people and their youth leaders to be quite. I did not like the fact that sunday morning the cops was called and the language that used. It would be nice to have a gym and i did not like the bar being downstairs. Finally the only thing I really liked was the pool and the people who worked there.

Reviews.Title: “Never had any problems”
Reviews.Author: crafterpa
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times. I've never had a bad experience. The rooms are large & clean. They have refrigerator, microwave, coffee pot, stove top & some dishes, utensils, & pot & pans.(what haven't been taken) The beds are comfortable pillow top mattress. The view of the bay is great. Yes sometimes the door sticks when closing & you have to pull a little harder, but I don't see what the big problem is. Also it has always been very clean. I've never seen a dirty tub or sink or room. I feel this is a very nice hotel & it's alot better then others I've stayed in here in OC. So give it a try for yourself & see what you think. We love it. Travelers for PA.

Reviews.Title: “Might be good for a bachelor party---not a family!”
Reviews.Author: rflorez3
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in "fair condidtion". From the lobby area it looks like a very nice hotel, but once you are in the room, you will find it to be a very average hotel, with damage to walls, carpet, etc., that should be repaired. When we were checking in there were a lot of angry people literally dripping in sweat and screaming about the broken A/C. Apparently the hotel did move some of those folks to another hotel. My room was actually okay as far as the A/C problem. We stayed in the "newer" building and did have the benefit of a nice balcony overlooking the bay. Unfortunately, though, an apparent bachelor party was taking place next to our room with lots of drunk men carrying on until 4:00 AM in their room and the hallway. We experienced it all including loud thuds on our wall in the middle of the night. I had to call the front desk to have someone try to get the "boys" to stop with the noise at 3:00 AM, which worked for all of about 20 minutes and they started right back up. My 10 year old daughters also unfortunately got to see two naked men standing knee deep in the bay at 11:00 PM one night when we returned from dinner. So much for the bay view. The pool was not "swimmable" very murky unhealthy looking water and our door had to be slammed very hard to close all the way. Kind of makes one nervous when you are a mom with two little girls next to a room of drunk men. Maintenance did try to fix the problem and they were very nice, but the door still did not work properly. I stayed in the hotel Thurs - Monday and apparently the bachelor party was a weekend event. The drunk men were also at the pool, drinking by 10:00 AM using vulgar language, etc. I personally would not stay here again unless the hotel went through a major renovation, including new management. One positive thing---very comfortable beds,without all of the noise, one could get a good nights sleep. At least the hotel invested in good mattresses.The GM for this hotel, whomever it is, should be removed in my opinion and the hotel should be revamped. With the proper improvements and management, this could be a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Andi21
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Princess Bayside a few times prior to this visit. We choose this hotel for our weekend getaway because it is close to Seacrets, a great bar/club/restaurant within walking distance. Also, because we enjoy the short distance to the beach. There is a newer part to the hotel in a separate building, which is where we stayed. We booked the suite overlooking the bay and were on the 3rd floor (room 335). Check-in was very quick and we were able to be placed on the same floor and right next door to our friends. This was a plus considering that the hotel was completely booked this weekend. Our room was clean upon arrival but definitely in need of updating. It felt a little bit run-down. A nice thing though was the Swedish tempur-pedic mattresses that had recently been added. They were very comfortable and made for a good night's sleep. Around the second day, after our room had been cleaned and vacuumed, a strong odor developed similar to if a dog had been kept in the room after a long day at the beach. Not kidding. It was definitely coming from the carpet - which led me to think that maybe the carpet needed to be ripped out and re-installed. Yes, this is a beach town and I understand that moisture can be an issue; however, this was not a mold smell. Our other friends did not have this problem. It was isolated to only our room. We did not attempt to get another room because we had already been informed the hotel was booked solid. We were only in the room to sleep and only for two nights, but I feel this should be noted. The small beach in front of our room was tidy and raked each morning. Hibiscus trees had been planted and it was a nice place to walk to in the morning and relax. Beach loungers also were set out. We had breakfast at the hotel the first morning (never dined here before). It was buffet style and not good. Wouldn't waste the money going there again. Service was awful/non-existent. Our server disappeared and I proceeded to hunt for utensils. We had to find her for the check and she barely said a word. In conclusion, I honestly wouldn't stay here if it were not walking distance to the beach and also if Seacrets were not nearby. We love to go to lunch there and sometimes go at night. It is a convenience factor. Plain and simple. Do I feel this hotel is worth what is paid per night? Absolutely not. But we found a great deal on Hotels.com for $124 per night for a bayfront suite and went for it. In conclusion, when you stay here just don't expect luxury...it is a place to sleep at best and nice to have extra amenities (fridge, microwave).

Reviews.Title: “Dump dump dump”
Reviews.Author: leslieander
Reviews.Content: Place STUNK, DIRTY FILTHY. Do yourself a favor, stay anywhere else but here... Filthy sink, tub, shower, stunk like an ashtray BAD BAD

Reviews.Title: “Okay...Princess Bayside Beach is not for me!”
Reviews.Author: VenusLibra04
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my stay at the Princess Bayside Beach hotel. I will have to say that it was totally not what I expected. I decided to take a trip with my 23 yrs old daughter. The first night we experienced being invaded by ants in the bathroom and on the end table. I will give credit to the security and maintenance staff they moved us right away and we even had a better view than the first room. The first room was a view of the construction and the main street. The second room was a view of the bay. Now, the staff that works behind the registration desk was not that friendly. What happen to meeting and greeting the guest with a smile! Geez! So, the security, maintenance and our housekeeper was very nice! Even if the housekeeper could not speak English. The hotel have a tip envelope for the housekeeper. I felt that was tacky. The hotel all you can eat buffet was very lame! For $28.95 the barely had much at the buffett. The Finnigan's Pub...had a huge roach that greeted us for breakfast while eating! One night me and my daughter went there for dinner and the staff ignored us for the longest before we decided to get up and leave. The best time my 23 yrs old daughter had was Seacret club! We had a blast there...drinks were great, but the food not so good! Overall I will have to say the price of the hotel was not worth it and Ocean City is pretty pricey. If you want to save money on spending on the over priced food book the efficiency room and cook your own meal! Oh and stay at a more expensive hotel...The Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but needs some work!!!”
Reviews.Author: vacationAug07
Reviews.Content: We picked the Princess Bayside Beach Hotel because it looked wonderful on the internet. When we arrived we went to our room and we had a private balcony and a bayside view which was beautiful, the room was wonderful. But the pools were discusting and green and very foggy, they were not one bit blue, we complained, but no one did anything the whole week we were there. We were very disappointed we went to that hotel because they had an indoor and outdoor pool, both dirty as hell. They tried to blame it on the rain, but the indoor pool looked the same way. I guess when you have a young girl cleaning the pools every night, they will look like that. We were Very pissed off for the money we spent, but had a goodtime anyway. That is our only complaint, otherwise the hotel was nice and the housekeeping was great.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money no matter how you justify it!”
Reviews.Author: blueviggen
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the lobby. It starts to give you the false sense that maybe, just maybe this place will be OK! But once you reach the elevator I can assure you that thought will quickly pass. The small stained elevator had an overwhelming sent of motor grease meets mildew so thankfully we only had to ride it to the 2nd floor. The hotel room itself didn’t smell but that didn’t really make us feel any better. From the get go we had the gut reaction to just stand because we were afraid to have any part of our bodies touch any of the surfaces in that room. The bathroom was small, had no exhaust fan and the hairdryer was from 1982 and smelled like burning hair every time I turned it on. The water temperature in the shower kept changing from a sane person’s water temperature to boiling hot then ice cold in a matter of seconds. The towels and bed sheets are an odd shade of putty and leave you with the unsettling feeling that they have never been bleached…. Not to mention that there were faded stains on them to remind you that you weren’t the only person who stayed there…creepy! We ruled out the indoor pool after just one look! Seriously, it’s called a chlorine tablet! Ever hear of it? Maybe try clarifier? Either way I was beyond shocked that anyone would actually step foot into that germ bath…but they did! But how they made it to the pool is a better question because to get there you pass through two doorways with a small vestibule that had an ungodly odor to it. The kind that causes you to spontaneously hold your breath for fear that if you take one more breath you may just vomit! (Never saw a rooftop pool) This review may be harsh but in reality for the price we paid I would expect much much more. The quality of this hotel was equivalent to what I would expect from a $69.00 room, not $285.00! And don’t even think of eating anything in this hotel! There is a pub attached called Finnegan’s but from the looks of the hotel we just safely assumed that we should eat elsewhere and save ourselves a bout of salmonella. On the plus side: The beach was clean, quiet and right across the street. And I guess if Seacrets is your main attraction… it is right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Has potential, needs updating”
Reviews.Author: jovigirl78
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it is conveniently located right next to Seacrets, which everyone knows as the reason to go to O.C.--- if you enjoy going out. I think that it is worth it to stay on the bay side also because the beach is only a block away, and you will pay much less than the oceanfront hotels. On the positive side, the room was clean, the sheets were clean, there was a microwave and fridge which I hadn't expected, and the woman who checked us in (Barb I believe), was extremely friendly and helpful. On the negative side, the rooftop pool was in the other building across the parking lot, which was inconvenient. People were afraid to go in the pool because it was so cloudy, but I am aware of shock treatments to pools that would do this. However, there is a mini pool bar that is overly expensive for weak drinks and could use some work. Basically, it looks like a temporary hut put together in a few minutes. I think they could do something to make it look nicer. Also, there was an indoor pool in our building, but good luck getting a towel there! My husband and I didn't bring our own since they had been used at the beach all day and I asked a man at the front desk if he could ask for more towels in the indoor pool and all he could say was,"They'll bring them." Well, 2 hours later we gave up and decided if they wanted our wet bodies going through the lobby, then that's what we would do. I understand that this is not a 5 star facility, but I think this hotel has a lot of potential if some changes would take place with service and updating in the rooms. (Our wallpaper was coming off in our bedroom.) It wouldn't be my first choice as a romantic getaway hotel choice. If you're a bunch of college kids wanting a clean bed after you stumble home from Seacrets, then this is the place to go!

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: micbar68
Reviews.Content: Was a very clean hotel and the staff were friendly. We did have problems with our air conditioner and they came right up and replaced it the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Time of my life”
Reviews.Author: KeeblerNewYork
Reviews.Content: I could'nt of ask for a better place to stay! All the staff was friendly and helpful. Anthony at the bar was the best. Can't wait to come back in June

Reviews.Title: “The Princess Bayside is a nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: mikebarnett
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Princess Bayside, from June 18 - 22, 2006, during the state firefighters convention. Room - We had a standard room in the main building, facing Coastal Highway. Noise could be heard during the night, coming from the street, from trucks to screaming people. They are also constructing some condos across the street from the hotel, and I would notice the sound of construction around 7:30 a.m. each morning. I would recommend asking for a room that doesn’t face the street. The room had a small fridge/freezer, coffee pot, hairdryer. We were able to call downstairs and have an iron and small ironing board brought to the room. When we asked for two extra pillows, the staff was prompt in bringing them up. The cleaning person was a Russian girl, who had trouble understanding that we just needed clean towels. It was hot during our stay and the air conditioning worked fine. I didn’t notice any significant smells (such as mold or mildew), but you’re down at the beach, and every place you stay at will probably have the saltwater and sand smell. The thing I didn’t like was that they didn’t use fitted sheets on the beds, the sheets would come un-tucked and rumble up during the course of the night. Pool – The roof-top pool was nice and secure. They had a good mix of kids and adults, and nobody was out of hand. The bartender closed the little bar they had at 4:00 p.m. (5:00 p.m. if he was busy enough). Selection was kind of limited. Beers – Coors Light and Miller Light for $3. Daiquiris and other alcohol ice drinks for $6. Hot dogs and Bar-B-Que, I think around $6. The Pool had an outdoor shower and provided towels for your use. Island music was piped in over the speakers. There was construction going on next door, so you have the sights and sounds going on with that. There were little pieces of Styrofoam that would blow into the pool from the construction site, but was cleaned up each day. They were pretty vigilant making sure that people didn’t bring their own food and drink to the rooftop pool, especially at night. The pools closed at 10:00 p.m. each noght. The indoor pool was nice, also had towels, but was a little hot and humid to just sit around at. The hotel had a little beach on the bay. It was nice to sit at, but I’m not sure if I would go swim in the water. The fireworks for the convention were shot off from a barge in the bay in front of the hotel and the hotels beach provided the best seats in Ocean City, (as well as the bay front rooms). The hotel is a short walk to the beach, but you have to walk around the construction site, some of the equipment and workers. There is also a covered parking area so your car doesn’t get to hot during the day. When I was checking in at the front desk, a foreign worker was there and couldn’t understand my name until I wrote it down. Other than that we had no problem. There are a lot more foreign workers in Ocean City, so try to deal with that, and you’ll be fine. We didn’t eat at Finnegan’s, but we did gets drinks there in the evening. Wasn’t too crowded, so try to stop in and see Liza, she’s a riot and will take good care of you. The Satellite Café next door had a great breakfast. Overall, The Princess Bayside is a pretty good place to stay and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for the price”
Reviews.Author: AndrewDoug
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on price and availability, which even in the pre-season is limited. The hotel is OK, aside from the standard rooms in the main bldg that were stuffy and the windows were sealed shut. We switched to the kitchenette suites with two beds and a fold-out sofa in the other bldg, which had balconies and bayviews, really quite decent. The bayside beach is calm and relatively warm, and a short walk away the ocean beach was clean and attractive (though in April the water is only 48°!) The location, around, 60th street, was far from the boardwalk but otherwise fairly central to restaurants and the innumerable minigolf courses, etc. The rooftop pool was not yet open in April, to the kids' disappointment, but then the hotel was sparsely populated. A number of things did not work in the rooms initially, but staff took care of them immediately. Staff was very nice. Security appeared fine, the locks are of the reprogrammable kind, and the rooms have safes. So, a hotel in need of renovation, but perfectly acceptable for the price (despite the extreme negative reviews here) and I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the PB for the past 3 years for our girlfriends weekend over the Labor Day holiday. The rooms are big and always clean. The staff is friendly but there should be some security up on the pool deck. I would agree with previous reviews about the pool area being filled with loud, semi-drunk young adults. This past summer, while the music was being piped in by the hotel, some young punks were playing their loud, obnoxious music that disrupted the entire atmosphere of the pool area. At least during this time of the summer, I would not recommend families with young children stay at this establishment. Big plus that it is next to Seacrets. The sunsets are magnificent!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a Sales Rep and the east coast of Maryland and Delaware are part of my territory. I have been staying at the Princess Bayside for the last six years when I need to travel for work. I am very comfortable here and consider this my home away from home. My experience is always consistent; a large clean room, great location, gorgeous view of the bay and a very courteous and professional staff. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the PB for a long "girls weekend". When we arrived we found that the sliding glass door was broken and off the track. It did not lock either. Five women in a room that does not lock. So much for feeling safe! There was a Party going on next door which was ok until all the party guests stared strippping and running into the bay! Our room was on the second floor bayside. We got quite a show. I would not reccommend this for families. I agree with most of the other posting as far as the smell of mold and mildew. We did not actually see it but it was there. One good thing is that it is very close to Seacrets! The pool was ok but there are ALot of "young" adults that hang out and drink. We are all thirty something and were looking for a quiet gettaway. This was not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Restful and Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was a getaway for a few days for our family. The room has clean and big. We had a wonderful view. Service was great. We had a bird in our room and they were prompt to get it out. Our family had a great time. We would recommend it highly! Also, our church had our men's conference at Princess Bayside and many commented that they enjoyed great food, service and room. Thanks for serving us well! We have recommended other churches to have their conferences at Bayside.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Princess Bayside”
Reviews.Author: emschick9
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Princess Bayside twice, once to check the place out and again to have our wedding there. Our families stayed there also for the wedding and we all had a wonderful time. The staff was very helpful and went above and beyond their call of duty to help us during our stay. Our rooms were nice but typical of a "mid range" hotel. We never had any problems with cleanliness of the rooms. The only part I did not like was the restaurant in the lobby. The service was horrible! I did discuss it with a manager and they were very apologetic but anyone in our families who ate there had the same complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible at the Princess Bayside Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After spending a three day weekend at this hotel, I will NEVER use the Princess Bayside Resort again! This is certainly not a resort! We arrived to find that NOT only was this hotel not on the oceanfront or boardwalk as advertised, but that it was also in the process of renovations that we were not notified of. In fact, to get to the beach you have to walk across Coastal Highway, go down a block and then climb over a sand dune to get to the beach. And I suppose they could say that they were on the boardwalk if you factor in that they are on 48th Street and the boardwalk starts at 20th Street. I guess that is close for them?!?!? One of two small elevators was broken the first day, the shower in our room had a leak from above, and the door between our room and the adjoining room didn't close entirely. We left a cell phone charger in the room, and after 5 calls and four days, to a security person to retrieve it, I was told that he didn't know if he had ours because they dont tag items, but if we paid for postage ($25), he would send something that may work. I told him that we called twice within an hour of leaving the hotel and that we had friends in the area that would have retrieved it, but he didn't seem to care that his ignoring of our call, or the fact that no other staff member would walk to check the room was horrible customer service. Do yourself a favor and next time, book on your own. Using the service stuck us with a 7 day no cancellation policy, where other hotels are satisfied with canceling within 24-48 hours. Princess Bayside Resort should not be on anyone's vacation plan. The hotel should take the advise of their customers in this and other reviews that I ignored in error.

HotelInfo.Name: Princess Bayside Beach Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 48th Street & Coastal Highway, Ocean City, MD 21842
